revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 14:21:14.000000000', 'message': "Baremetal: Be more patient with IPMI and BMC

Before we called 'power status; power on' in a loop which made the
IPMI/BMCs not behave well.  Also the total time we would wait (2.5
seconds wasn't always enough).  So make sure power on/off is only called
once and wait up to 10 seconds for the power state change to go into
effect.

This patch has been tested on real baremetal using
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/TripleO/TripleOCloud

This bug is also linked to ironic so the change will be made there as
well.

Change-Id: I5a4d7c84ebdf9c1f7d8d0570dbc31764c31f1fc6
Closes-Bug: #1234479
(cherry picked from commit 6e30bbc126a1ad4eb87e735c812832f4fcc0054e)
"}]
commit_message:
Baremetal: Be more patient with IPMI and BMC

Before we called 'power status; power on' in a loop which made the
IPMI/BMCs not behave well.  Also the total time we would wait (2.5
seconds wasn't always enough).  So make sure power on/off is only called
once and wait up to 10 seconds for the power state change to go into
effect.

This patch has been tested on real baremetal using
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/TripleO/TripleOCloud

This bug is also linked to ironic so the change will be made there as
well.

Change-Id: I5a4d7c84ebdf9c1f7d8d0570dbc31764c31f1fc6
Closes-Bug: #1234479
(cherry picked from commit 6e30bbc126a1ad4eb87e735c812832f4fcc0054e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 15:38:47.000000000', 'message': "Add boto special casing for param changes in 2.14

boto 2.14 has some interface changes with the get_http_connection
call which adds port as a non optional parameter *in the middle of*
existing non optional parameters. It's a special kind of incompatible
change.

We are already special casing around boto in the unit tests, lets
just do more of that if we are running on a newer version.

(cherry picked from commit 1ce493b9e4e0c381146287161ab2a3c75f1fc603)

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1237944
Change-Id: If388d872286eca15bf24a582db1bac22224a8b24
"}]
commit_message:
Add boto special casing for param changes in 2.14

boto 2.14 has some interface changes with the get_http_connection
call which adds port as a non optional parameter *in the middle of*
existing non optional parameters. It's a special kind of incompatible
change.

We are already special casing around boto in the unit tests, lets
just do more of that if we are running on a newer version.

(cherry picked from commit 1ce493b9e4e0c381146287161ab2a3c75f1fc603)

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1237944
Change-Id: If388d872286eca15bf24a582db1bac22224a8b24

commit_message:
Adds V3 API specific urlmap tests

Adds V3 API versions of the urlmap unittests. These test that
the V3 content is returned when expected in the format expected.

Adds the extension plugin as being discoverage in the fake policy
files for the unitests to provide some easily known data to check
for the urlmap tests.

Updates extension info api sample tests

Partially implements v3-api-unittests

Change-Id: I67f2a3516ffee02b6dbf258ee35e1fd084ba060c

Version 1.0 from the HttpClient perspective is not backward
compatible.  Horizon has trove integration in Havana and

issues for the Havana release.

commit_message:
temporarily cap python-troveclient version

Version 1.0 from the HttpClient perspective is not backward
compatible.  Horizon has trove integration in Havana and
significant rework would be required to fix the compatibility
issues for the Havana release.

This cap would only be for the Havana release.

Partial-bug: #1238121

Change-Id: I52e8ddc4a8f79ec7f358a07d00aabe9c2046b6c7

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-10-07 06:29:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(19 inline comments)

Interesting stuff, comments from a first look through it"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-07 14:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (11 inline comments)

I need to investigate the boolean thing (after coffee), as splitting the field/type way may make that hard.

I also tend to think that splitting in that manner might be overengineering the problem just a bit, when the nullability behavior is really expressable in a decorator on those top-level methods, leaving only the "type" behavior in the actual implementations.

Would you be opposed to just moving the meat (the _foo methods) into the toplevel methods and decorating each with something that would handle the nullability behavior?'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-07 14:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Right, so I'm not crazy about the boolean thing, I just typo'd that to None instead of False and everything is willing to tolerate it.

So, going forward, we can remove this "Unspecified booleans default to False" behavior if it really bothers you, and then go forward with the field/type split if you think that's the right approach. Alternately, we could introduce a "default" notion to the Field, which would let us say "unspecified booleans are assumed to be false":

 Field(BooleanFieldType(), nullable=False, default=False)

Where if nullable=False and default!=None, then a None value gets converted to whatever the default is if unspecified.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-10-07 16:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (6 inline comments)

Main things inline apart from some small details is the field/type split and documenting the non-obvious field semantics

This:

  Field(BooleanFieldType(), nullable=False, default=False)

looks interesting for sure.

From that description it sounds like nullable means "the value read from the field can never be None"

I'm not totally opposed to going ahead without the field/type split, but I'd play around with the idea myself before +2ing ... so it's probably worth you playing with a little and see if you like it'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-07 16:09:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The boolean thing is my only (real) reason for not wanting to separate the field and the type. However, if we can have default=<something> on the field, then I'm fine with it.

I'll work on making that separation and see how it goes, hopefully pushing up a new set today or tomorrow to look at."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-07 22:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-07 22:28:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

So, this includes the Field/Type split. The split provides a really nice way to make Dict and List types re-use more code, which I definitely like. I don't like the syntactical change required in the object definitions, but it's not horrible. I have an idea about how to reduce some of the ugly syntax for dicts and lists, which might help.

So, I don't like the syntax, but I think the model is more sound, so I think we should keep this."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-07 23:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

This is the very beginning of what I've been thinking for cleaning up the syntax:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/48094/

The first change makes the compound fields (dict and list) able to insert the extra Field layer themselves, removing one level of gorp from such a definition.

The second creates a set of commonly-used field types that would massively reduce the verbosity of their declaration in actual objects.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-10-08 16:35:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I updated this with the non-contentious feedback, and have also added helper classes to clean up the syntax the way I was planning and would prefer it. Functions could be used in place of the helper classes, but I don't really think it matters much in terms of lines of code, and I think I prefer this. However, I'm not overly concerned with it, so if functions make someone else feel better, I'll change it.

Note that I *only* updated the aggregate patch on top of this one to demonstrate usage and will finish the rest if/when we can settle on a syntax. I'm a bit tired of rebasing 20 patches :)

Thanks all!"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-08 22:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Add Field model and tests

This adds the base for a structured field definition, which gets us
away from just using simple coercion functions to define our fields.
That gets messy and spreads code to coerce data apart from the
serialization and deserialization bits.

This aims to unify and better define our data types in objects.
Note that this change doesn't affect any of the *actual* format
of the fields, which is highlighted by the general lack of change
to the actual object tests as a result.

Related to blueprint structured-object-fields

Change-Id: I3bd8441f11c3bc599b9a6250d31ae1ece4165ecb

[{'created': '2013-10-09 09:29:42.000000000', 'message': "fallocate image only when user has write access

Libvirt will change instance's ownership when the instance became power
off which will make nova-compute service unable to hard reboot instance
bacause the nova-compute service has not write access. This commit will
allocate space for image only the first time we create image.

Fixes bug: 1200113
Conflicts: nova/tests/test_imagebackend.py
Change-Id: Id81b09ade5f870665f5ffabab3cde144c6dec210
Cherry-picked: c246fb37e20197be27264a36515725233085df1d
"}]
commit_message:
fallocate image only when user has write access

Libvirt will change instance's ownership when the instance became power
off which will make nova-compute service unable to hard reboot instance
bacause the nova-compute service has not write access. This commit will
allocate space for image only the first time we create image.

Fixes bug: 1200113
Conflicts: nova/tests/test_imagebackend.py
Change-Id: Id81b09ade5f870665f5ffabab3cde144c6dec210
Cherry-picked: c246fb37e20197be27264a36515725233085df1d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-03 14:54:26.000000000', 'message': 'Libvirt: make boot dev a list in GuestConfig

In order to make boot order more flexible based on the block device
mapping passed, we need to customize the domain xml presented to
libvirt, by specifying more than one boot element. Fro more info see
http://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsOSBIOS. Currently the boot
element is hard coded to "hd" by the libvirt driver.

This patch makes it possible to specify more than one boot element that
will give us more flexibility.

Related-bug: 1229327
Change-Id: I38abe9edaa8f93469d58ad81a466f68c2c0d24d6
'}, {'created': '2013-10-04 14:33:19.000000000', 'message': 'Libvirt: make boot dev a list in GuestConfig

In order to make boot order more flexible based on the block device
mapping passed, we need to customize the domain xml presented to
libvirt, by specifying more than one boot element. Fro more info see
http://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsOSBIOS. Currently the boot
element is hard coded to "hd" by the libvirt driver.

This patch makes it possible to specify more than one boot element that
will give us more flexibility.

Related-bug: 1229327
Change-Id: I38abe9edaa8f93469d58ad81a466f68c2c0d24d6
'}, {'created': '2013-10-04 15:33:51.000000000', 'message': 'Libvirt: make boot dev a list in GuestConfig

In order to make boot order more flexible based on the block device
mapping passed, we need to customize the domain xml presented to
libvirt, by specifying more than one boot element. Fro more info see
http://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsOSBIOS. Currently the boot
element is hard coded to "hd" by the libvirt driver.

This patch makes it possible to specify more than one boot element that

commit_message:
Libvirt: make boot dev a list in GuestConfig

In order to make boot order more flexible based on the block device
mapping passed, we need to customize the domain xml presented to
libvirt, by specifying more than one boot element. For more info see
http://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsOSBIOS. Currently the boot
element is hard coded to "hd" by the libvirt driver.

This patch makes it possible to specify more than one boot element that
will give us more flexibility.

Related-bug: 1229327
Change-Id: I38abe9edaa8f93469d58ad81a466f68c2c0d24d6

commit_message:
Libvirt: add boot_index to block device info dicts

Block devices have a boot_index parameter, which is used to determine the
boot device.

This patch makes it part of the device_info internal libvirt driver
structure so that we can make use of it to do fine grained boot ordering
in subsequent patches.

Related-bug: 1229327

Change-Id: I23f2f7637a6ed023785a0ffde050fbd43402c655

There's already a 'obj_clone' method, and I think it should be used instead. :)  It does a deepcopy, which would also solve this problem, and I'd think that would be more efficient than serialize/deserializing."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-10-08 08:03:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'd agree with Chris - I was expecting to see deepcopy when I clicked on the patch."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-10-08 16:44:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

There's no need to define a new protocol for properly copying python objects. Define __copy__() or __deepcopy__() as needed.

http://docs.python.org/2/library/copy.html"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-08 20:28:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My bad for missing that we already had a obj_clone() :)

However, deepcopy() totally screws up mox for me. See this:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/48107/

AIUI, deepcopy attempts to be "smart" about things and does a bunch of odd change tracking to do that. If we can get the fields stuff merged, then we can have a __deepcopy__ helper on those and, presumably, do it cleanly.

So, I will s/obj_copy/obj_clone/ and resubmit so that I can address feedback on stuff above this. If you know how to solve the thing in the pastebin, then that's fine. Otherwise, right now conductor is _broken_ because of this, so even though this is less efficient ...'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-10-08 21:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-08 21:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-07 22:24:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix conductor's object change detection

Conductor was doing a copy.copy() on the inbound object to later
detect changes that should be sent back to the caller. This does not
copy things like Instance.system_metadata and thus is incapable of
properly detecting changes that should be tracked.

This patch introduces a NovaObject.obj_copy() method which provides
a suitable copy service.

Change-Id: I46ae8b0694dc31a90c1a5cdf76757d877877f072
"}, {'created': '2013-10-08 21:21:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix conductor's object change detection

Conductor was doing a copy.copy() on the inbound object to later
detect changes that should be sent back to the caller. This does not
copy things like Instance.system_metadata and thus is incapable of
properly detecting changes that should be tracked.

This patch makes the NovaObject.obj_clone() method do a total out-of-
body clone by taking the object through a serialize/deserialize
pass.

Change-Id: I46ae8b0694dc31a90c1a5cdf76757d877877f072
"}, {'created': '2013-10-08 22:02:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix conductor's object change detection

Conductor was doing a copy.copy() on the inbound object to later
detect changes that should be sent back to the caller. This does not
copy things like Instance.system_metadata and thus is incapable of
properly detecting changes that should be tracked.

This patch makes conductor use obj_clone() which does a deepcopy.

Note that this confuses quota unit tests because the Quotas object
caches nova.quota.QUOTAS, which was getting copied as well.
A trivial change to eliminate that confusion is included here.

Closes-bug: #1237102
Change-Id: I46ae8b0694dc31a90c1a5cdf76757d877877f072
"}, {'created': '2013-10-09 16:30:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix conductor's object change detection

Conductor was doing a copy.copy() on the inbound object to later
detect changes that should be sent back to the caller. This does not
copy things like Instance.system_metadata and thus is incapable of
properly detecting changes that should be tracked.

This patch makes conductor use obj_clone(), and modifies it to
copy the object by deserializing a serialized version, which should
be a very "clean room" way of constructing a copy.

Note that this confuses quota unit tests because the Quotas object
caches nova.quota.QUOTAS, which was getting copied as well.
A trivial change to eliminate that confusion is included here.

Closes-bug: #1237102
Change-Id: I46ae8b0694dc31a90c1a5cdf76757d877877f072
'}, {'created': '2013-10-09 18:31:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix conductor's object change detection

Closes-bug: #1237102
Change-Id: I46ae8b0694dc31a90c1a5cdf76757d877877f072
'}, {'created': '2013-10-09 20:57:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix conductor's object change detection

Conductor was doing a copy.copy() on the inbound object to later
detect changes that should be sent back to the caller. This does not
copy things like Instance.system_metadata and thus is incapable of
properly detecting changes that should be tracked.

This patch makes conductor use obj_clone(), and imports Chris
Behrens' __deepcopy__ fix for objects so that deepcopy works.

Closes-bug: #1237102
Change-Id: I46ae8b0694dc31a90c1a5cdf76757d877877f072
"}]
commit_message:
Fix conductor's object change detection

Conductor was doing a copy.copy() on the inbound object to later
detect changes that should be sent back to the caller. This does not
copy things like Instance.system_metadata and thus is incapable of
properly detecting changes that should be tracked.

This patch makes conductor use obj_clone(), and imports Chris
Behrens' __deepcopy__ fix for objects so that deepcopy works.

Closes-bug: #1237102
Change-Id: I46ae8b0694dc31a90c1a5cdf76757d877877f072

commit_message:
add some tests for user api

make a seperate file test_users_negative.py and move exist negative tests
over to it,also add some negative tests to it

- test_create_user_with_enabled_non_bool
- test_create_user_with_enabled
- create_user
- test_update_user_for_non_existant_user
- test_update_user_request_without_a_token
- test_update_user_by_unauthorized_user
- test_delete_user_request_without_a_token

Change-Id: I5a87d72ecb94046809faf0ce14b1af347c2e4dcc

commit_message:
Add security group to large_ops test

There have been some issues with performance around security groups in
the past. Lets make sure they don't exist.

We gate on test_large_ops as part of gate-tempest-devstack-vm-large-ops

Change-Id: Ib655deab9fc12df969b47552d7d8edc999c0d06a

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-09-20 20:03:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Code mostly looks good and works in my testing.

I'm not sure about the formpost thing; formpost comes before auth in the pipeline, and quotas come after auth, so by the time the quota middleware sees the request, it's already a PUT. Adding in the quota checking around object POSTs is going to mean that people can't change metadata on objects in a container that's over quota, and that seems undesirable."}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2013-09-21 10:14:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Samuel: regarding the quota check on POST requests - I agree with you and will remove that change, thanks for the advice. That raises the question if it makes sense to remove the check on POST requests in account_quota middleware too?'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2013-09-21 10:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2013-09-21 10:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Work In Progress

commit_message:
Handle X-Copy-From header in container_quota middleware

Content length of the copied object is checked before
allowing the copy request according to the container quota.

Closes-Bug: #1201875
Change-Id: If44b916791e94ac6c66eee04a5727186ce0e56ae

commit_message:
Replaces mox with mock for test_deploy_utils

OpenStack is moving to use mock instead of mox for unit tests
in order to be ready for python 3. This patch changes the
test cases for deployment utils from using mox to mock.

Change-Id: I90bf90310a955a8797dd884e9846f8aeb07524e0

commit_message:
Replaces mox with mock for conductor unit tests

OpenStack is moving to use mock instead of mox for unit tests
in order to be ready for python 3. This patch changes the
test cases for conductor from using mox to mock.

Change-Id: If8e97a2af483540c3931ecd1fb7f06a529b3a370

commit_message:
Make devstack engine more flexible

Ability to make custom localrc.
Ability to specify devstack repository in config file.
Added sshutils.

Change-Id: I0e1286e4c9a9674abd4cd96323903b1a64d9d101

commit_message:
fix ssh driver exec command issues

when executing ssh commands the ssh driver is not pre-pending the
base command. This patch corrects this issue. It also ensures returned
results are parsed correctly.

Change-Id: I34da562e3d49f49b7f3eb2c79681042a01c83692

I think having these sections one level higher up makes them
easier to find. When searching, readers are more likely to associate

Change-Id: I14951c94b43a548aad1e8a31747e7cdcc7a2f2e7

commit_message:
Move Volume & Backup Driver sections up a level

I think having these sections one level higher up makes them
easier to find. When searching, readers are more likely to associate
with a driver for their very real-world equipment,
compared to looking below a set of configuration options.

Change-Id: I14951c94b43a548aad1e8a31747e7cdcc7a2f2e7

why this exists.

As of this fix:

  https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/pull/34

which was released in eventlet 0.13, we no longer need the patch.

This has now been removed from oslo-incubator, so this is really just
syncing that removal.

Change-Id: I84267f3c6726cb2e750f615e107c48b12c6ed353
'}]
commit_message:
Remove obsolete redhat-eventlet.patch

See I62ce43a330d7ae94eda4c7498782a655e63747fa for the gorey details on
why this exists.

As of this fix:

  https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/pull/34

which was released in eventlet 0.13, we no longer need the patch.

This has now been removed from oslo-incubator, so this is really just
syncing that removal.

Change-Id: I84267f3c6726cb2e750f615e107c48b12c6ed353

Agreed with gordon that we need to add a test case to ensure that all callings into python-ceilometerclient are correct, at least in the interface level."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-10-10 08:58:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@gordc: well, I think that's just an unfortunate side-effect of the dynamic nature of the mock library. It doesn't care if the class being mocked actually has a particular attribute or not, it'll just mock up whatever you ask it to.

This is the case right across the board in our unit tests, so I'm sure that there's an easy resolution that'll prevent problems of this nature. Really what's needed is system/integration test coverage, which would have caught this issue immediately.

However, I don't think we need to hold up this fix for RC2 by attempting to also address the potential issue around attribute errors in code creeping in if the same error is reflected in the mock setup for the tests.

If I've missed a more obvious way of addressing this, please shout.

Thanks,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-10-10 09:05:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 4491, 'date': '2013-10-10 09:22:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

OK, let's not hold this for rc2."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-10 09:22:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 19:07:43.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure combination alarms can be evaluated

Fixes bug 1237589

Previously the retrieval of state for the constituent alarms always
failed for combination alarms, due to an incorrect attribute of
ceilometerclient being used. As a result combination alarms could
never be successfully evaluated.

Now the correct pluralized attribute is used.

Change-Id: Id58a5d185854367e5a08011048774ab5aed93d4e
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure combination alarms can be evaluated

Fixes bug 1237589

Previously the retrieval of state for the constituent alarms always
failed for combination alarms, due to an incorrect attribute of
ceilometerclient being used. As a result combination alarms could
never be successfully evaluated.

Now the correct pluralized attribute is used.

Change-Id: Id58a5d185854367e5a08011048774ab5aed93d4e

[{'created': '2013-10-09 22:26:39.000000000', 'message': "Use built in cleanup for servers in test_large_ops

The  scenario base class has code  to properly clean up servers and
wait until they are fully deleted.  Use this instead of custom cleanup
which doesn't wait for delete to complete.

Change-Id: Ic9fe5ea0d267116d5bc78f50d1945602e5247d6a
"}]
commit_message:
Use built in cleanup for servers in test_large_ops

The  scenario base class has code  to properly clean up servers and
wait until they are fully deleted.  Use this instead of custom cleanup
which doesn't wait for delete to complete.

Change-Id: Ic9fe5ea0d267116d5bc78f50d1945602e5247d6a

messages:

commit_message:
Switch from poking at services to waiting on heat.

Heat wait conditions are semantic rather than 'oh look it seems to
work' which allow us to avoid race conditions much more easily than
super-careful retries on every API. At least for now, this is
preferrable as we don't have a stable base on which to iterate.

Change-Id: I6a625167e747bb57d0887f1ced79661fbb147477

(cherry picked from commit 61af83ddd832e63deb4b72fa11c7b18df7ae4702)

commit_message:
Ensure combination alarm evaluator can be loaded

Fixes bug 1237578

Previously combination alarms were always skipped as the evaluator
was missing from the loadable stevedore extensions.

Change-Id: I9d164fb2a89ee9931fc032d93ad4a26ba6887f0b
(cherry picked from commit 61af83ddd832e63deb4b72fa11c7b18df7ae4702)

commit_message:
Notify IRC when tripleo-cd completes.

This will let us detect failures and dogpile on them, crude but effective.

Change-Id: If923f20d61e024066d83d06e14fc1584368f8392

commit_message:
improves lvm version parsing for customised builds

supports_thin_provisioning now uses a regexp to ensure parsing of
lvm version succeeds when the build is customised; also adds a test
for a customised string parsing

Closes-Bug: #1237994
Change-Id: I49049a58bbdb5315b9d2d7c259a9324ca15d78cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 20:36:51.000000000', 'message': 'Remove obsolete redhat-eventlet.patch

See I62ce43a330d7ae94eda4c7498782a655e63747fa for the gorey details on
why this exists.

As of this fix:

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/pull/34

which was released in eventlet 0.13, we no longer need the patch.

This has now been removed from oslo-incubator, so this is really just
syncing that removal.

Change-Id: I84267f3c6726cb2e750f615e107c48b12c6ed353
'}]
commit_message:
Remove obsolete redhat-eventlet.patch

See I62ce43a330d7ae94eda4c7498782a655e63747fa for the gorey details on
why this exists.

As of this fix:

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/pull/34

which was released in eventlet 0.13, we no longer need the patch.

This has now been removed from oslo-incubator, so this is really just
syncing that removal.

Change-Id: I84267f3c6726cb2e750f615e107c48b12c6ed353

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 11:45:35.000000000', 'message': "add boto special casing for param changes in 2.4

boto 2.4 has some interface changes with the get_http_connection
call which adds port as a non optional parameter *in the middle of*
existing non optional parameters. It's a special kind of incompatible
change.

We are already special casing around boto in the unit tests, lets
just do more of that if we are running on a newer version.

Change-Id: If388d872286eca15bf24a582db1bac22224a8b24
"}, {'created': '2013-10-10 12:19:46.000000000', 'message': "add boto special casing for param changes in 2.4

call which adds port as a non optional parameter *in the middle of*
existing non optional parameters. It's a special kind of incompatible
change.

We are already special casing around boto in the unit tests, lets
just do more of that if we are running on a newer version.

Change-Id: If388d872286eca15bf24a582db1bac22224a8b24
"}, {'created': '2013-10-10 12:49:26.000000000', 'message': "add boto special casing for param changes in 2.4

boto 2.4 has some interface changes with the get_http_connection
call which adds port as a non optional parameter *in the middle of*
existing non optional parameters. It's a special kind of incompatible
change.

We are already special casing around boto in the unit tests, lets
just do more of that if we are running on a newer version.

Note: this does a terribly hacky version compare, this should be
done better, but trying to see if this works as a fix approach.

existing non optional parameters. It's a special kind of incompatible
change.

We are already special casing around boto in the unit tests, lets
just do more of that if we are running on a newer version.

done better, but trying to see if this works as a fix approach.

Change-Id: If388d872286eca15bf24a582db1bac22224a8b24

commit_message:
Add boto special casing for param changes in 2.14

boto 2.14 has some interface changes with the get_http_connection
call which adds port as a non optional parameter *in the middle of*
existing non optional parameters. It's a special kind of incompatible
change.

We are already special casing around boto in the unit tests, lets
just do more of that if we are running on a newer version.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: #1237944
Change-Id: If388d872286eca15bf24a582db1bac22224a8b24

subject: Return 401 when action is not authorized

commit_message:
Return 401 when action is not authorized

When a user is not authorized to access to something is the API,
this one return 401 instead of 400 now.

Fixes bug #1232045

(cherry picked from commit b2df5f9013f6d30097d5841027a759af0e9c8002)

Change-Id: I37ef87f79cd55e095132e0865cbaa324cd76323c

.v.

self.assertGreater(stats["total_capacity_gb"], 0)

I'm not seeing an improvement in readability, the code is longer and I'm not aware of any other benefit. Is there a PEP for this?'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-10-10 03:10:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

This patch is not about how the changes will enhance the existing code but the benefits it will bring when there is a consensus of using these assertion methods.

AssertTrue is prone to write errornous test scripts which are false positives. For example,

assertTrue(X, 3, 'X less than 3')

when the author meant

assertTrue(X > 3, 'X less than 3')

This was an error I found in Nova which was sitting there for months.

By using assertGreater, these errors will hardly ever occur."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-10 14:42:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-10-10 14:42:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Ok, thanks, that's a good benefit. Approved."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-10 16:57:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified

commit_message:
Clean up comparison assertions

Using assertTrue and the comparison operators to test
if an element is greater, equal, or less is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework 'testtools' supports
- assertEqual
- and testtools Matcher classes
which were created for these types of tests.

Re-implemented assertGreater and assertGreaterEqual
with compatibility for python < 2.7.

Change-Id: I6f3e3279630393e594c75d30cb4b895c2e2c22ca

commit_message:
Replaces mox with mock for test_utils

OpenStack is moving to use mock instead of mox for unit tests
in order to be ready for python 3. This patch changes the
test cases for utils from using mox to mock.

Change-Id: I38e997652f70cb6e0c9743801ea50401f3d6654b

commit_message:
db2 does not allow None as a key for user_id in user collection

mongodb allows None value as a key for _id field, but db2 does not.
this patch will fix the problem when meters coming with user_id
being set to None.

fixes: bug #1234165
(cherry picked from commit 77a0603bebcb25fba94ddfb40e50baed46eb9384)

Change-Id: Icdb53e0835faf7d469a8af882a3dcd7e161a1d1d

as it defers to the nested stack to determine if any

Change-Id: Iae7e6b7e2f41d2f5bd9e75256be7533c15762d9f
'}]
commit_message:
Make templateResource not replace on update

Updating a template resource is never destructive
as it defers to the nested stack to determine if any
sub-resources needs to be replaced.

Closes-bug: #1236676
Change-Id: Iae7e6b7e2f41d2f5bd9e75256be7533c15762d9f

commit_message:
Update functional tests for swift changes

It seems that a couple of changes to the store calls have slipped
through unnoticed:

* store.add() now returns a 4-tuple
* x-container-read and x-container-write headers use tenant:user rather
  than just tenant.

fixes bug 1236339

Change-Id: Ic5c311bcc2999e13203e0d3ad37bce5ac5f27e2d

commit_message:
Fixes rbd _delete_image snapshot with missing image

Also ignore if _delete_image returns NotFound when cleaning up
following failed attempt to create a new image with add().

Also added unit tests.

Change-Id: Id66866b4260385a6324cc277c5ac665f81493c89
Fixes: bug 1233097

commit_message:
Add some test-cases for cinder cli

Add some omitted test-cases for cinder-cli in tempest

 + test_cinder_credentials
 + test_cinder_availability_zone_list
 + test_cinder_endpoints
 + test_cinder_service_list
 + test_cinder_transfer_list
 + test_cinder_bash_completion

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 02:49:45.000000000', 'message': "Add keystoneclient CredentialsManager if missing

The keystone v3 client doesn't include the 'ec2' manager, even
though the EC2 API is included in the default pipeline.

This commit creates the ec2 manager manually if it's missing
(and necessary). It uses the same call that the client itself
should have used.

Change-Id: I83e7bfa04cde5093c10bf2bc27af5ec03da4b48e
Closes-bug: #1236326
"}]
commit_message:
Add keystoneclient CredentialsManager if missing

The keystone v3 client doesn't include the 'ec2' manager, even
though the EC2 API is included in the default pipeline.

This commit creates the ec2 manager manually if it's missing
(and necessary). It uses the same call that the client itself
should have used.

Change-Id: I83e7bfa04cde5093c10bf2bc27af5ec03da4b48e
Closes-bug: #1236326

After some more thought, I'm still really uncomfortable with this different HTTP error handling. While everything here looks correct, it feels like a big risk for future problems.

How about this change instead? It would let us translate anticipated exceptions during serialization into HTTPExceptions by ensuring those HTTPExceptions are dealt with properly.

diff --git a/glance/common/wsgi.py b/glance/common/wsgi.py
index 47a6e2b..8d1c314 100644
--- a/glance/common/wsgi.py
+++ b/glance/common/wsgi.py
@@ -608,7 +608,9 @@ class Resource(object):
             response = webob.Response(request=request)
             self.dispatch(self.serializer, action, response, action_result)
             return response
-
+        # if serialization produces a webob.exc.HTTPException, just return that
+        except webob.HTTPException as e:
+            return e
         # return unserializable result (typically a webob exc)
         except Exception:
             return action_result"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-27 18:40:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

I can see where you're coming from with this approach, but I would like you to reconsider the advantages of the patch suggestion I posted before.

With the change I suggested for common/wsgi.py, we're fixing serialization of  *all* http errors that happen during the process of trying to serialize a regular response. But we wouldn't actually try to map between internal exceptions and http error codes in the common code. That mapping is left to the specific resource serializer. 

If you can see what I'm trying to say, I think you should go back to just catching webob.exc.HTTPException in the common code, which will require putting the appropriate mapping code in the serializer. In particular, we'll still have to do

  try:
      ...
  except exception.Forbidden as e:
      raise webob.exception.HTTPForbidden(e)

in the glance.api.v2.images.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-09-30 16:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Whoops, wish I could edit my comment!

I meant to say

s/in the glance.api.v2.images/in the glance.api.v2.images serializer _format_image function/'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2013-10-02 14:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

@markwash, I should explain my current fix earlier. Actually, I understand your previous suggestion. But THO, it doesn't work as we expected. Because webob.exc.HTTPException can't be serialized. commit_message:
Glance GET /v2/images fails with 500 due to erroneous policy check

This patch will fix below two issues of V2 ResponseSerializer for
images-list, image-show, image-update and image-download.

1. A user should be able to list/show/update/download image without
needing permission on get_image_location.
2. A policy failure should result in a 403 return code. We're
getting a 500.

Fixes bug 1231255

Change-Id: Ie0ec2d574eea4433c4f610ec66a22cb16cae6dc6

commit_message:
Remove start index 0 in range()

Remove the useless arg ("start index" = 0) in files, since its default
value is 0, to make code cleaner.

Change-Id: I9d91ab8a8033b9a6c9b77608dea92c91a994c7fc

commit_message:
Set python-six minimum version

missing python-six minimum version from the requirements.txt
set the min version to 1.4.1

fixes bug: #1237205

Change-Id: I6b821e4500178f4ca50e05c4893c8bbaacfc238e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 06:07:23.000000000', 'message': 'Allow tests to run with both provenances of mox

We currently have a requirement for mox >= 0.5.3.

Confusingly there are two flavours of "mox 0.5.3"
in the wild:

1) pypi's mox-0.5.3.tar.gz (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mox)
2) Google's mox-0.5.3.tar.gz (https://code.google.com/p/pymox/)

These are not exactly the same; tests which can pass on (1) may
fail on (2).

Fedora packages are based on (1) while Debian/Ubuntu packages
are based on (2).

This is a known issue: https://code.google.com/p/pymox/issues/detail?id=40

When running the tests using a virtual env (1) is used, but
on Debian/Ubuntu when not running using a virtual env (2)
will be used: this leads to 3 of the 1740 tests failing.

This patch allows all 1743 tests to run whether you are running
in a virtual env or using Debian/Ubuntu/Fedora packages.

Fix for bug 1212625.

Change-Id: Ib0b11ec18aafbfb7f3d243bf149b94f93a1c13c9
'}]
commit_message:
Allow tests to run with both provenances of mox

We currently have a requirement for mox >= 0.5.3.

Confusingly there are two flavours of "mox 0.5.3"
in the wild:

1) pypi's mox-0.5.3.tar.gz (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mox)
2) Google's mox-0.5.3.tar.gz (https://code.google.com/p/pymox/)

These are not exactly the same; tests which can pass on (1) may
fail on (2).

Fedora packages are based on (1) while Debian/Ubuntu packages
are based on (2).

This is a known issue: https://code.google.com/p/pymox/issues/detail?id=40

When running the tests using a virtual env (1) is used, but
on Debian/Ubuntu when not running using a virtual env (2)
will be used: this leads to 3 of the 1740 tests failing.

This patch allows all 1743 tests to run whether you are running
in a virtual env or using Debian/Ubuntu/Fedora packages.

Fix for bug 1212625.

Change-Id: Ib0b11ec18aafbfb7f3d243bf149b94f93a1c13c9

[{'created': '2013-10-10 03:47:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add quota table in PLUMgrid plugin

Quota DB driver is enabled in Neutron by default.
PLUMgrid plugin was missing the "quota" table. It has
been added in this commit.

Fix bug# 1236970

Change-Id: I5170a8be2b412a3bcf1edcacce5574f0073b84d4
(cherry picked from commit 23bec4f7cb6e84a8d717c0b5ccc222f51c67f072)
'}]
commit_message:
Add quota table in PLUMgrid plugin

Quota DB driver is enabled in Neutron by default.
PLUMgrid plugin was missing the "quota" table. It has
been added in this commit.

Fix bug# 1236970

Change-Id: I5170a8be2b412a3bcf1edcacce5574f0073b84d4
(cherry picked from commit 23bec4f7cb6e84a8d717c0b5ccc222f51c67f072)

subject: long flashcopy operation may block volume service

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-03 22:32:26.000000000', 'message': 'long flashcopy operation in Storwize driver blocks volume service

Storwize family uses flashcopy for snapshot or volume clone. The
volume delete has to wait until flashcopy finishes or errors out.
The _delete_vdisk() will poll volume FlashCopy status in a loop.
This may block volume serivce headheat since it is in the same
greenthread. The solution is to use openstack FixedIntervalLoopingCall
to run the FlashCopy status poll in a timer thread.

The cinder volume mananger will resume delete operation for those
volumes that are in the deleting state during volume service startup.
Since Storwize volume delete may wait for a long time, this can cause
volume service to have long delay before it becomes available.
A greenpool is used to offload those volume delete operations.

Change-Id: Ie01a441a327e1e318fa8da0040ae130731b7a686
Closes-Bug: #1203152

commit_message:
long flashcopy operation may block volume service

Storwize family uses flashcopy for snapshot or volume clone. The
volume delete has to wait until flashcopy finishes or errors out.
The _delete_vdisk() will poll volume FlashCopy status in a loop.
This may block volume serivce heartheat since it is in the same
. The solution is to use openstack FixedIntervalLoopingCall
to run the FlashCopy status poll in a timer thread.

The cinder volume mananger will resume delete operation for those
volumes that are in the deleting state during volume service startup.
Since Storwize volume delete may wait for a long time, this can cause
volume service to have long delay before it becomes available.
A greenpool is used to offload those volume delete operations.

Change-Id: Ie01a441a327e1e318fa8da0040ae130731b7a686
Closes-Bug: #1203152

commit_message:
Skip tests that rely on boto until we can update them for 2.14.0

The consensus seemed to be that we should skip these to immediately
repair the gate and then work on fixing them.

Related-bug: #1237944
Change-Id: I3b4cedbf874032d70f5037cf974993dc6a80578c

commit_message:
Disassociate floating IPs from port on terminate

Bugfix - floating IPs were left associated after VM
was terminated. Now call disassociate_floatingips
within delete_port as in other networking plugins.

Add L3NatDBIntTestCase suite to cover the
floating IP disassociation case, and fix all failing
tests from that suite.

Change-Id: I856c46631e495d513065fc9e987898408441a21e
Closes-Bug: #1231913
(cherry picked from commit f4b78c7f17e29448ed54b136eeb4ac700b324120)

The username value should be returned, not the self.user value,
otherwise you unexpectedly get inconsistent results if you ever
override the username after creating the object.  Some tests
added, one of which illustrates the problem.

Change-Id: I95e416e3046607d8b0406812705949e8ff464f86
Closes-Bug: #1237459
'}, {'created': '2013-10-10 11:40:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix RequestContext.to_dict user/username inconsistency

The username value should be returned, not the self.user value,
otherwise you unexpectedly get inconsistent results if you ever
override the username after creating the object.  Some tests

commit_message:
Fix RequestContext.to_dict user/username inconsistency

The username value should be returned, not the self.user value,
otherwise you unexpectedly get inconsistent results if you ever
override the username after creating the object.  Some tests
added, one of which illustrates the problem.

Change-Id: I95e416e3046607d8b0406812705949e8ff464f86
Closes-Bug: #1237459

common case (Ceilometer and watchrule) and safe in the other cases.

Change-Id: Iee88968b52ec15addf4721e004d2994b2f8c2134
Closes-bug: #1224434
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the signal details string

This could come from multiple places so try make it useful in the
common case (Ceilometer and watchrule) and safe in the other cases.

Change-Id: Iee88968b52ec15addf4721e004d2994b2f8c2134
Closes-bug: #1224434

commit_message:
Do not allow the same member to be added twice

This patch add an existence check before add new member for image.

Fixes bug 1231485

Change-Id: I10d37c6f169e070ea6699cca78b6360be9fb11dc

commit_message:
Signal on stack-ready in the overcloud.

This is needed with Heat now waiting for the wait condition to be
signalled.

commit_message:
Signal on configuration completion.

The completion-handle comes from Heat Metadata e.g.
    Metadata:
      completion-handle: {Ref: StackCompleteHandle}

Change-Id: I7202e94a2d327c4e5d3023b02d7c0417ffd0e354

commit_message:
Skip tests that rely on boto until we can update them for 2.14.0

The consensus seemed to be that we should skip these to immediately
repair the gate and then work on fixing them.

Change-Id: I4878e8d2963648a6ed7cbf3ad7496019092ce874
Related-bug: #1237944

commit_message:
feat: storage sharding schema for marconi-queues

This provides a base jsonschema for handling PATCH and PUT requests to
a future /v1/shards/{shard_name} endpoint.

Change-Id: I10c817ff8b5c196a2a3b2f5562e1bafc34e30adf
Partially-Implements: blueprint storage-sharding

Tests for Client-ID validation

commit_message:
Use the pipeline for the storage layer

This patch integrates the pipeline between the transport and the storage
layer. This will allow have filters before getting to the final storage
and even implement the ShardManager as a Pipe itself.

Implements blueprint storage-pipeline

Change-Id: I428421d9f3d6c2b8f05597073f341689e186960c

(2 inline comments)

I like how this approach is shaping up. Essentially, we have a list of transformers/filters, and this forms the pipeline.

I'll have more comments for the second patch, but this one works for me!

commit_message:
Implement common pipeline class

This patch implements a common Pipeline class that can be used in
different areas to mock the way middleware chains work.

Implementation is very simple and straightforward, not much magic is
needed there.

Partially-Implements blueprint storage-pipeline

Change-Id: Ie94008c92d27379b9b2bc83dd895c0daf5565ae8

commit_message:
Display commands when running reset-db

Add a '-x' to reset-db, as the db_sync commands don't say what service
they are running for.

Change-Id: I0e33ac87f699361bd1d161f450b4f0ac1c524fb3

subject: Fix typo in 'Download Capacity CSV report' feature implementation. Add test for CapacityLogCsvHandler. Minor changer on capacity description on the Support page
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-09 15:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-noop http://logs.openstack.org/85/50685/1/check/gate-noop/8b7e64c : SUCCESS in 1s
'}, {'account_id': 8749, 'date': '2013-10-10 08:09:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You didn't answer on questions in previous review request
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50095/4/nailgun/nailgun/api/handlers/capacity.py"}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2013-10-10 09:06:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Can't publish comments for old patch sets.
CSV file could be created by user and sent to a support team. So we need some mechanism to prevents manually changes in a CSV report. This checksum will be verified by a support team"}, {'account_id': 8749, 'date': '2013-10-10 11:20:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think checksum doesn't make sense.

1. if somebody want to check this md5, he should parse csv, recreate python dictionary in the same order as it was originally created (it isn't trivial) and then serialize it to json in the way as it was serialized in the nailgun.

2. if user generated this file, what is the point for him to change it?"}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2013-10-10 11:32:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Checksum is just fool protection from file modifications. From David's comments: "As mentioned in E-mail, the way to avoid the user modifying the file is to put a checksum in the file - but that's a nice to have.  This model is based quite a bit on trust in the user to want to conform to their purchase and is just a way to double check that they're actually staying in compliance.   And you're also correct that if a checksum isn't used, we can check the logs."'}, {'account_id': 8749, 'date': '2013-10-10 11:44:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

Ok, it's nice to have feature from PO.

What about 1 point? You cannot calculate (at least it's very difficult) md5 sum on the other side."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2013-10-10 12:39:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-10 12:42:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

Change-Id: I6acf9fd0e7a22ee3069f816da18abaa8f1f783cc

Change "POST" to "PUT" and use os-extra_specs/{key_id} instead of
flavors/{flavor_id}/os-extra_specs URI

Change-Id: I6acf9fd0e7a22ee3069f816da18abaa8f1f783cc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue in api-ref for API "os-extra_specs"

1)Fix API for updating the value of the specified extra-spec key.
Change "POST" to "PUT" and use os-extra_specs/{key_id} instead of
flavors/{flavor_id}/os-extra_specs URI

2)Add flavor extra_spec delete API

Change-Id: I6acf9fd0e7a22ee3069f816da18abaa8f1f783cc

Changes the rpc_support_old_agents config variable default value to
False, so that the vlan_id field (redundant with the segmentation_id
field) is no longer included in RPC messages from the linuxbridge and
mlnx plugins to their corresponding L2 agents. This can be set to True
if needed to support L2 agents older than midway through the havana
cycle.

Closes-Bug: 1235323
Change-Id: I919824c5b02e28e3563e64e98bb106bf722327ec
(cherry picked from commit f969d47a959ee1aa309cb697ea6a27965278810a)
'}]
commit_message:
Change rpc_support_old_agents default to False

Changes the rpc_support_old_agents config variable default value to
False, so that the vlan_id field (redundant with the segmentation_id
field) is no longer included in RPC messages from the linuxbridge and
mlnx plugins to their corresponding L2 agents. This can be set to True
if needed to support L2 agents older than midway through the havana
cycle.

Closes-Bug: 1235323
Change-Id: I919824c5b02e28e3563e64e98bb106bf722327ec
(cherry picked from commit f969d47a959ee1aa309cb697ea6a27965278810a)

commit_message:
Add Ubuntu/Debian configuration to Controller.

Ubuntu and Debian don't have openstack-config available, so alternative
instructions must be provided.

Change-Id: Iccad69a1b514c8605b52212727fab0055cb9ef92

commit_message:
python3: Refactor dict for python2/python3 compat (part2)

Python3 changed the behavior of dict.keys such that it is now
returns a dict_keys object, which is iterable but not indeable.
You can get the python2 result back with an explicit call to list.

Change-Id: Ia23184983e180ae9a8641b56708968c78910ef5b
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add some docs on how to setup Ceilometer to use Alarms

We need to use Ceilometer's mongo backend if we want to use
alarms as the sql backend is missing a feature.

Works around bug #1223710

Change-Id: Ib569cfd650ce14480496530e7bbf1b2f71a24c02

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 08:53:22.000000000', 'message': "Adding 'download_image' policy enforcement to image cache middleware

Currently image cache middleware not care 'download_image' policy, the
enforcement caused user receive empty content but with HTTP 200 code
rather than 403 when client attempt to download image using v2 API. And
the real Forbidden exception be logged in glance-api log which image
application action raised. The end user is confused by this behavior.

Fixes bug: 1235378

Related-Id: Ibaa7ccf8613ee3cce4cb6a72e3206a2c94122222
Change-Id: I2822ee553d605b7d49576c886f42fa403cdbccf2
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit a50bfbf490fd354d08abd25b67aaab83b2a17a85)"}]
commit_message:
Adding 'download_image' policy enforcement to image cache middleware

Currently image cache middleware not care 'download_image' policy, the
enforcement caused user receive empty content but with HTTP 200 code
rather than 403 when client attempt to download image using v2 API. And
the real Forbidden exception be logged in glance-api log which image
application action raised. The end user is confused by this behavior.

Fixes bug: 1235378

Related-Id: Ibaa7ccf8613ee3cce4cb6a72e3206a2c94122222
Change-Id: I2822ee553d605b7d49576c886f42fa403cdbccf2
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit a50bfbf490fd354d08abd25b67aaab83b2a17a85)

commit_message:
Savanna/Murano tags processing

Tags processing was added for savanna/murano deployments. Corresponding
to them tests were updated. Some non major fixes were added to unit
tests. In functional tests data about particular tests from testset was
removed from expected for the sake of simplifying testing process.

Savanna/Murano tags processing

Logic that produce processing of deployment tags for savanna/murano
deployment was modified.

Change-Id: I05586913116ade39fc8babb55aa56ef10cc83aab

commit_message:
Add cinder prop image, deprecate imageRef

This change does a lookup on the provided image so that
an image name or UUID can be specified in the property.

imageRef has been documented as being deprecated.

Closes-Bug: #1234263

commit_message:
Update lockutils from oslo-incubator

This commit updates lockutils from oslo incubator which adds a
LockFixture class. This also converts the tempest LockFixture to wrap
the fixture from oslo.

Change-Id: I4f5007109fa6ceff868c23d55d9962f9d703bb1f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 09:48:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix possible race issue with test_engine_service

There's the potential for racy behavior in test_show_watch, because
the result of show_watch(self.ctx, watch_name=None) is all watches
visible to the user, not only those for a specific stack.  So it's
possible that the result length will be more than two, and since the
watch name is also not unique, we could see spurious test failures.

So make the test assertions more specific, and avoid reusing the same
watch name in test_show_watch_metric.

Change-Id: Ibb1cbae04dee4b6c4ada44336143fd122a3cb53f
Closes-Bug: #1237324
"}]
commit_message:
Fix possible race issue with test_engine_service

There's the potential for racy behavior in test_show_watch, because
the result of show_watch(self.ctx, watch_name=None) is all watches
visible to the user, not only those for a specific stack.  So it's
possible that the result length will be more than two, and since the
watch name is also not unique, we could see spurious test failures.

So make the test assertions more specific, and avoid reusing the same
watch name in test_show_watch_metric.

Change-Id: Ibb1cbae04dee4b6c4ada44336143fd122a3cb53f
Closes-Bug: #1237324

[{'created': '2013-10-09 20:54:56.000000000', 'message': 'rados-gw is incompatible with swift

Registering a keystone endpoint for rados-gw confuses Glance into using
rados-gw as object storage backend even when Swift is selected as Glance
backend (see also PRD-2012, PRD-2013).

This change drops objects_swift option from release.json and sets
objects_ceph in the setup wizard based on the Glance storage backend
selection made for images_ceph.

Change-Id: I2764b0924a3888b44047513afe59ea08612bcb2e
'}, {'created': '2013-10-09 22:06:24.000000000', 'message': 'rados-gw is incompatible with swift

Registering a keystone endpoint for rados-gw confuses Glance into using
rados-gw as object storage backend even when Swift is selected as Glance
backend (see also PRD-2012, PRD-2013).

This change drops objects_swift option from release.json and sets
objects_ceph in the setup wizard based on the Glance storage backend
selection made for images_ceph. Settings tab sets the images_ceph
checkbox when objects_ceph is set, and unsets objects_ceph when
images_ceph is unset.

Change-Id: I2764b0924a3888b44047513afe59ea08612bcb2e
'}, {'created': '2013-10-09 22:23:04.000000000', 'message': 'rados-gw is incompatible with swift

rados-gw as object storage backend even when Swift is selected as Glance
backend (see also PRD-2012, PRD-2013).

This change drops objects_swift option from release.json and sets
objects_ceph in the setup wizard based on the Glance storage backend
selection made for images_ceph. Settings tab sets the images_ceph
checkbox when objects_ceph is set, and unsets objects_ceph when
images_ceph is unset.

Change-Id: I2764b0924a3888b44047513afe59ea08612bcb2e
'}]
commit_message:
rados-gw is incompatible with swift

Registering a keystone endpoint for rados-gw confuses Glance into using
rados-gw as object storage backend even when Swift is selected as Glance
backend (see also PRD-2012, PRD-2013).

This change drops objects_swift option from release.json and sets
objects_ceph in the setup wizard based on the Glance storage backend
selection made for images_ceph. Settings tab sets the images_ceph
checkbox when objects_ceph is set, and unsets objects_ceph when
images_ceph is unset.

If you suggest this solution for actual state of master it will be wrong. We have fixed this bug in alembic migration 17738166b91. And it works. You can see in https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/migration.py#L69 (alembic migrations will be syncing after all migrations in migrate_repo). More then we have a patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/46841 that replaces all alembic migrations by one migration in migrate-repo. And your code will not work for DB2 suppport case (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/46974/8/ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/17738166b91_fix_meter_resource_m.py).'}, {'account_id': 8106, 'date': '2013-09-25 22:39:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Svetlana Shturm,thanks for your comments, I can not open the change which id is 17738166b91, you mean it fixed this resource.resource_metadata to text type, right? And for DB2 support, it is covered by another fix 46974 I think. And what is solution you proposed?'}, {'account_id': 8106, 'date': '2013-09-26 00:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

And alembic does not support DB2 as well now, but for sqlalchemy migration, it supports DB2.'}, {'account_id': 6507, 'date': '2013-09-26 10:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

I mean a alembic revision https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/17738166b91_fix_meter_resource_m.py that was successfully merged to master. And actual state of master will use this migration.'}, {'account_id': 8106, 'date': '2013-09-26 23:00:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Svetlana Shturm, yes, agree with you, I take 17738166b91_fix_meter_resource_m.py as reference to fix this resource table issue at first time(from first patch), you can check out my patch 8, however I try several times, the same fix with 17738166b91_fix_meter_resource_m.py does not work in our Jenkins building system, will hang at alembic call, I double checked my env, and install same alembic version 6.0 with Jenkins env, can not find such hang issue, so have to give up alembic and turn to use sqlalchemy migration solution, the fix can pass the Jenkins validations, and as we know for alembic, will be removed from h release, so sqlalchemy migration should be a proposed solution I think.'}, {'account_id': 8106, 'date': '2013-09-26 23:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

FYI - the fix of "Database migration cleanup I - Alembic translation"  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/46841/'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-09-27 09:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

i'll let someone with better knowledge approve this.

for reference (abandoned alembic solution): https://review.openstack.org/#/c/49175/"}, {'account_id': 4491, 'date': '2013-10-10 06:46:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-04 13:56:19.000000000', 'message': '> Change resource.resource_metadata column type to Text
>
> The existing resource.resource_metadata column size is 5k chars, which is not enough for some large JSON metadata payload, so change to as Text column to make sure store all JSON string without truncating.
>
> Fixed bug #1220683

Change-Id: Ide8c6b94f1ae56d76fe3d5b6238d44e498e67c03

commit_message:
Change resource.resource_metadata to text type

The existing resource.resource_metadata column size is 5k chars,
which is not enough for some large JSON metadata payload,
so change to as Text column to make sure store all JSON string
without truncating.

Fixes bug #1220683

Change-Id: Ide8c6b94f1ae56d76fe3d5b6238d44e498e67c03

commit_message:
Remove an unsed target from Makefile

notcompute.yaml seems to be unsed for a while, but it's
still present in Makefile (its dependencies were removed
by change I952c630ca424d114feb643a6c34d182cad660f26).

Change-Id: If5d84bd822f748c962cdb2b95b6bbd5d5e1f11fa

commit_message:
Don't update interfaces in db if there are no interfaces with ip which belongs to admin subnet.
* update_interfaces_info use node object instead of id
* fix fixtures sample_environment.json add ip for interfaces
* check interfaces before update
* fix ui test

Change-Id: If282d1f2e8c07e0d821915d38cef02f8856177e5

commit_message:
Add a waitcondition for signalling stack-up.

Without this we need horrible hacks to detect whether the cloud is
ready to use.

Change-Id: Ic5c5fd16c6c283d3d339e1f1238d3349d0b93f7c

commit_message:
Encode values as utf-8 before encrypting

Ensure strings are correctly encoded before encrypting

This is necessary because some encryption libraries don't handle
the unicode conversion appropriately.

Conflicts:
	heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py

Change-Id: Iebbf32e57ba21d955c1984ee32360379579366c8
Closes-Bug: #1207707

commit_message:
Updated/edited Image chapter.

Install: Added short intro. Turned steps into procedures.
  Fixed the credentials. Added note about using IP address.
  Commented out redundant config.
Verify: Added link to Virtual Machine Image Guide. Turned steps into procedure.
  Added info about -is-public value.

Change-Id: I27b8397957ac352b25e868d821e9c921d6ec80c9

commit_message:
Remove unused EDP JSON validation schemes to prevent confusion

There are some JSON validation schemes that are no longer used. These
should be removed because they may mislead developers looking at the
code (what job types are supported, data source endpoints, etc)

Change-Id: Idc83f1d503aae166bf5392e4e21824fdd19f5a8d

AFAICT we only want NeutronNativePXE when DHCP_DRIVER is set to

Change-Id: I592eddba14cb58696e8344ece48f36177a5174f5
"}, {'created': '2013-10-09 05:14:22.000000000', 'message': "Don't set NeutronNativePXE=True with dm-dnsmasq

commit_message:
Don't set NeutronNativePXE=True with bm-dnsmasq

AFAICT we only want NeutronNativePXE when DHCP_DRIVER is set to
neutron-dhcp-agent.

Change-Id: I592eddba14cb58696e8344ece48f36177a5174f5

commit_message:
Fixes encoding issues for nova api req body.

* Ensure utf-8 encoding for POST/PUT body for api requests
* As per https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Encoding.

Fixes bug #1180344

Change-Id: I6acb8ae565b25943a50bff9fb8c9923fdf77e738
(cherry picked from commit 781815b3b27cc3fcbf153db57deb9bd82ae1d8d3)
Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/wsgi.py

commit_message:
Correct handling args.backup in do_create

We have to use args.backup, not self.backup.

Change-Id: I1f3c892cd4e9c1a42586bdd34d5239cb90c9af74

commit_message:
Add domain information to context

As a feature of V3 API keystoneclient adds some
information about the domain to the requestheaders.
That information is the ID and the name of the domain.

That information might be used when processing requests
so it should be stored in in the security context.

Fixes: bug #1221609

Change-Id: I5a6f2c6d9f7e25578b3d061340362d021370de86

'}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-09-30 00:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Appreciate you taking the time to work on this, but as I wrote on the bug this setting was never intended to disable the "Create Image" button completely. We use this option in production to disable just the ability to upload local images. With the setting enabled it should still be possible to create new images by giving a remote URL.

The original review that added this is here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21808/

You can follow the discussion there to see why the option exists.'}, {'account_id': 6763, 'date': '2013-10-02 02:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

hi Kieran: so the bug is invaid or we can deal with it in any other way?'}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-10-02 05:14:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Lawrance. I'd treat the bug as a feature request. We shouldn't change the behaviour of the HORIZON_IMAGES_ALLOW_UPLOAD setting. But you could resubmit your change using a setting with a different name. But keep in mind Gabriel's last comment on the bug - this feature may be possible anyway when RBAC is properly implemented."}, {'account_id': 6763, 'date': '2013-10-02 12:07:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

hi Kieran: now i have your point, thanks :)'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-10-10 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Disable Create Image button

If "HORIZON_IMAGES_ALLOW_UPLOAD = False", may be it's clear
that we remove the "Create Image" button from the interface.

Change-Id: Ia14fd4e09d35fd0b5772e8d8ba456528165bf1a4
Fixes: bug #1215921

commit_message:
added clustertype support

Adds support for clustertypes.  These are analgous to
"flavors" for clustering/replication.

partially implements bp/reddwarf-replication

Added to topic clustering

Change-Id: I50d50415ced76ed529f9b3c3949ba4d3a13de57d

"}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2013-10-01 18:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

To be more specific:

Swift is used more than just in openstack and by many with distributions that are not "officially" supported  by openstack.  It is a bit dishonest to just bump a minimally required version of a req for no other reason than to be equal with the rest of openstack.  Leaving the version lower allows other packagers know what the absolute minimum requirements are for swift for packaging.  This also doesn't break the other goal of working with the rest of openstack, as the newer versions work as well.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-10-01 18:06:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(1 inline comment)

I don't understand our strategy here.  Why would say we require the latest version of these packages when we do not?"}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-10-01 19:22:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I can understand wanting all projects to support specific versions of dependencies (so we can recommend distros package them), but I'm not sure why we can't also support other versions that work."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-10-01 20:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-10-02 01:36:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-10-02 14:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(3 inline comments)

This cannot merge as-is, but the process of automatically adding the global requirements is good. If there are problems with the list of dependencies (there are), we should update the global list.

Also, this functionality for adding requirements needs a solver to ensure that older versions are ok.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-10-10 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-10-10 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

[{'created': '2013-09-17 15:48:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing ceilometer-dbsync errors when using DB2 and sqlalchemy

When using Ceilometer with DB2 and sqlalchemy, executing
"ceilometer-dbsync" results in many errors. So we need to
change codes to choose reasonable way to work with DB2
database.

Fixes bug 1225914

Change-Id: I7c6298551f3615368abaa0107be692986d8028f2

commit_message:
Fixing ceilometer-dbsync errors when using DB2 and sqlalchemy

When using Ceilometer with DB2 and sqlalchemy, executing
"ceilometer-dbsync" results in many errors. So we need to
change codes to choose reasonable way to work with DB2
database.

Fixes bug 1225914

Change-Id: I7c6298551f3615368abaa0107be692986d8028f2

Build succeeded.

- gate-taskflow-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/99/49099/3/check/gate-taskflow-pep8/8407a95 : SUCCESS in 1m 01s

- gate-taskflow-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/99/49099/3/check/gate-taskflow-python26/eaa928c : SUCCESS in 1m 47s
'}, {'account_id': 7366, 'date': '2013-10-02 06:15:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Code looks good to me, but I don't know if we should merge this now:
 
- such retry can be easily (and more flexibly) implemented by task authors, inside execute();
- thus, i see more value in retrying part of flow: if some of later tasks fails, revert up to this task and then try again (like checkpointing); if we implement this, we'll have two features doing essentially the same, but in different ways;
- i feel really uneasy about merging more features distributed engine does not support.

That are just my concerns, maybe they are not really problems and we should go on with this?"}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-10-02 18:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Maybe after 0.1 release might be more appropriate. Sound good?'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2013-10-02 18:03:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-10-10 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

commit_message:
Add simplistic retry support

Allow for a task to specify how many execution
retries will be supported if the task fails to
execute due to an exception.

Change-Id: I1541897aa3e8949b8aef08ff9041acccc85c331a

I don't like the Devices class.  We already have the ondisk module, let's just use functions there.

OTOH, It would simplify some things if we could plugin at obj.server.ObjectController._diskfile - so I'm not against the idea of moving the per device Threadpool dispatching down one out of obj.server - which think it especially manageable when you also move the async_pending update onto a class that we can plugin (which would be a especially nice to have, IMHO)

So

diskfile.DeviceFileFactory class - probably
ondisk.Devices class - probably not yet"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-10-10 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

Refactor on-disk knowledge out of the object server by pushing the
async update pickle creation to the new DiskFileManager class (name is
not the best, so suggestions welcome), along with the REPLICATOR
method logic. We also move the mount checking and thread pool storage
to the new ondisk.Devices object, which then also becomes the new home
of the audit_location_generator method.

For the object server, a new setup() method is now called at the end
of the controller's construction, and the _diskfile() method has been
renamed to get_diskfile(), to allow implementation specific behavior.

Change-Id: Id945276037dbbeb8a778753e47a7316cd408eac7
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Refactor on-disk knowledge out of object server

Refactor on-disk knowledge out of the object server by pushing the
async update pickle creation to the new DiskFileManager class (name is
not the best, so suggestions welcome), along with the REPLICATOR
method logic. We also move the mount checking and thread pool storage
to the new ondisk.Devices object, which then also becomes the new home
of the audit_location_generator method.

For the object server, a new setup() method is now called at the end
of the controller's construction, and the _diskfile() method has been
renamed to get_diskfile(), to allow implementation specific behavior.

Change-Id: Id945276037dbbeb8a778753e47a7316cd408eac7
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move keystone DB init to the end.

We can't use anything until keystone is ready, so it makes a natural
synchronisation point. This won't fix all our races but it will avoid
some of them. We probably need to explicitly indicate to heat 'this
cloud is deployed' rather than poking at API's etc.

Change-Id: Ib287bbdc273a8e10e7450964f73632de7fedfb39

commit_message:
Bump wait_for overcloud to configure br-ctlplane to 20 minutes

Bump wait_for up from 14 minutes to 20 minutes to be safe.  Saw
devtest_overcloud timeout at this point and when tried to ping manually
everything worked. So it looks like 14 minutes is not enough.

Change-Id: I1baec9506c93841d889da0876cc32c736d773f56

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 13:51:38.000000000', 'message': 'NEC plugin: Fix nec-agent unexpected exit due to RPC exception

Changes nec-agent to catch RPC exceptions in the main
daemon loop. It fixes the following two bugs.

- nec-agent dies with RPC timeout in secgroup RPC
  (Closes-Bug: #1235106)

- port_added message can be dropped when RPC timeout occurs
  (Closes-Bug: #1235111). Moves exception catch from PluginApi
  to the main daemon loop.

test_nec_agent.py is added during Havana.
The base class and related tests are imported.

Change-Id: I12394b739fc35bff271543f4625c5e3152e534ae
(cherry picked from commit 3df505e448d38929c20721b22d81e47bf917af6a)
'}]
commit_message:
NEC plugin: Fix nec-agent unexpected exit due to RPC exception

Changes nec-agent to catch RPC exceptions in the main
daemon loop. It fixes the following two bugs.

- nec-agent dies with RPC timeout in secgroup RPC
  (Closes-Bug: #1235106)

- port_added message can be dropped when RPC timeout occurs
  (Closes-Bug: #1235111). Moves exception catch from PluginApi
  to the main daemon loop.

test_nec_agent.py is added during Havana.
The base class and related tests are imported.

Change-Id: I12394b739fc35bff271543f4625c5e3152e534ae
(cherry picked from commit 3df505e448d38929c20721b22d81e47bf917af6a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 20:01:37.000000000', 'message': 'Make Neutron NVP plugin future-versions friendly

This patch enables the plugin to deal correctly with
newer versions of the NVP platform; this is done by
allowing the plugin to fall back to the closest known
version of the NVP platform. This is acceptable behavior
as L2/L3 operations implemented by the platform are most
certainly backward compatible.

This patch also improves test coverage for this part of the
code, which is critical to the correct behavior of the plugin.

Fixes bug #1217479

Conflicts:

	neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_nvplib.py
	quantum/plugins/nicira/nicira_nvp_plugin/nvplib.py

Change-Id: Idddad8b0a5a1709683611bac6f239b18f90ee99b

commit_message:
Make Quantum NVP plugin future-versions friendly

This patch enables the plugin to deal correctly with
newer versions of the NVP platform; this is done by
allowing the plugin to fall back to the closest known
version of the NVP platform. This is acceptable behavior
as L2/L3 operations implemented by the platform are most
certainly backward compatible.

This patch also improves test coverage for this part of the
code, which is critical to the correct behavior of the plugin.

Fixes bug #1217479

Conflicts:

	neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_nvplib.py
	quantum/plugins/nicira/nicira_nvp_plugin/nvplib.py

Change-Id: Idddad8b0a5a1709683611bac6f239b18f90ee99b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 19:48:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix dhcp_release lease race condition

There is a possible race condition when delete or updating fixed_ips
on ports where an instance could renew its ip address again after
dhcp_release has already been executed. To fix this, the order of
reload_allocation and release_lease need to be switched. This way an
instance will not be able to renew it's ip address after it is
removed from the host file.

Fixes bug: 1237028

Change-Id: If05ec2be507378c634f5c1856dab0fbd396f43cc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dhcp_release lease race condition

There is a possible race condition when delete or updating fixed_ips
on ports where an instance could renew its ip address again after
dhcp_release has already been executed. To fix this, the order of
reload_allocation and release_lease need to be switched. This way an
instance will not be able to renew it's ip address after it is
removed from the host file.

Fixes bug: 1237028

Change-Id: If05ec2be507378c634f5c1856dab0fbd396f43cc

commit_message:
Modifying tests to use the compat client

Modifies tests so they use the old style client code.
This is still exercising the actual v1.* code, it is
just accessing it via the compat module.

partially implements blueprint cli-compliance-upgrade

Change-Id: I5578525325416a28d7ab772ad0817f49ff6c6611

[{'created': '2013-10-08 18:48:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fail stack-create if script exits with non-zero status

commit_message:
Fail stack-create if script exits with non-zero status

If the heat-script or cfn-userdata script exits with a non-zero
status, the user will see which script failed and where to find
the debug log on the server.  This will allow the template author to
conditionally fail a stack-create in the user_data section.

Change-Id: Ibc3768d8192102b9057d4ba873058cb50abcd1b1

Neutron ERRORs in logs are so numerous and inconsistent between runs
that maintaining a whitelist is useless at this point.

Change-Id: I024d17973ded36777b23cad6ebe51523e81dd648
"}]
commit_message:
Don't check logs for ERRORs with neutron

Neutron ERRORs in logs are so numerous and inconsistent between runs
that maintaining a whitelist is useless at this point.

Change-Id: I024d17973ded36777b23cad6ebe51523e81dd648

commit_message:
Add support for a service type env var

Rackspace is currently setting their service types to weird things.
Support them, because we love special snowflakes.

Change-Id: I1519be00a3086945338a953bc2a1e7a4e0e65400

Introduce refs to other guides
Change Nova to Compute

commit_message:
Search all dependencies to check which books to build

So far we only checked one level of depth for inclusion of modified files.
This let to missed book builds.

Now, we check all dependencies, even over multiple includes.

Rename args to silence pylint warnings.

Change-Id: I78df8803f17cdb736230c2137277bb3886071e85
