commit_message:
Massive refactoring to the troveclient

The new client adheres to the standards of the other clients
now. It prints out tables, uses ENVVAR's for auth, no longer
stores pickled json in a login token, uses openstack common,
and moves the cli operations into a v1 module for the future
of trove when it has a v2 api.

Please note for compatibility, the troveclient.compat module
has the old cli. In order to deploy it, amend the setup.cfg
to include the compat module.

implements blueprint cli-compliance-upgrade

Change-Id: Ie69d9dbc75ce90496da316244c97acca1877a327

commit_message:
Add help for purge_deleted command age argument

At a bare minimum explaining this argument helps understand what
purge_deleted is going to do.

Change-Id: If73ba272e8ea0742f8be93994ec2fac68d4ed3fd

Users should be aware that things may change before a stable release. I think the number of users who are creating volumes of existing glance images using OS::Cinder::Volume will be ~1 so the impact should be reasonably small.'}, {'account_id': 7761, 'date': '2013-10-09 06:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The change is great!'}, {'account_id': 7761, 'date': '2013-10-09 06:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-10-09 07:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Steve are you sure? Thomas implemented this in early May, quite a few people follow trunk. In my mind that is a good amount of time to get people using it. It makes me worried to
break api.'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-10-09 09:33:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Steve are you sure? Thomas implemented this in early May...

So my 0.02, I think that it's non-ideal to change interfaces after the first RC has been cut, and we should never change interfaces without a good reason.

However this resource is still a pre-release feature, so I don't think we need to say the interface is frozen until it's released as part of Havana.

If folks are running from master, they must be regularly dealing with much more inconvenient changes than this, surely?"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-10-09 18:44:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We will need to be able to deprecate properties sooner or later. I'll add an 'image' property and document imageRef as deprecated. Once the properties schema supports deprecation then imageRef can be properly flagged as deprecated"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-10-09 19:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-09 21:01:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 21:04:06.000000000', 'message': "Rename cinder prop imageRef->image, do name lookup

This change does a lookup on the provided image so that
an image name or UUID can be specified in the property.

Since imageRef is no longer being transparently passed
through to the cinder API, the property is renamed to
'image'.

As a consequence, this change will need to make it into
the havana RC2 release before the cinder resource interface
is frozen. Any templates will need updating.

Closes-Bug: #1234263
Change-Id: I95190e3f53ddac8eb41306b7003aa93e75886eb7
"}, {'created': '2013-10-09 19:59:34.000000000', 'message': 'Add cinder prop image, deprecate imageRef

This change does a lookup on the provided image so that
an image name or UUID can be specified in the property.

imageRef has been documented as being deprecated.

Closes-Bug: #1234263
Change-Id: I95190e3f53ddac8eb41306b7003aa93e75886eb7
'}]
commit_message:
Add cinder prop image, deprecate imageRef

This change does a lookup on the provided image so that
an image name or UUID can be specified in the property.

imageRef has been documented as being deprecated.

Closes-Bug: #1234263
Change-Id: I95190e3f53ddac8eb41306b7003aa93e75886eb7

commit_message:
Enforce 'download_image' policy in cache

Ensure that cached images do not bypass the
'download_image' policy.

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50016.

Fixes bug 1235378.

Change-Id: I2082445ecb4703e642e9ff518b275846e7a8d573

floating IP is disassociated. It was incorrectly sending the
tenant's network when the update is to the external network the
floating address belongs to.

commit_message:
BigSwitch: correct net to backend on floating IP disassociation

The corrects the network that is updated on the backendw when a
floating IP is disassociated. It was incorrectly sending the
tenant's network when the update is to the external network the
floating address belongs to.

Closes-Bug: #1237209
Change-Id: I55211ba3b0062e167843830bb318eb8e46249160

@Joe Gordon - as I recall it was always on the user to get a new token.  This change appears to only prevent the issuance (erroneously) of a new token when verifying the current token.  The new token's issuance keeps the expiry among other things.  This change looks to simply prevent the issuance of new tokens needlessly (when your current token is valid)"}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2013-08-02 22:35:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

After further discussion on this issue within IRC, the conclusion is as follows:

This is in-fact a bug addressed by this patchset, however, there is the issue that it seems like the caching-capabilities of novaclient do not encompass the management_url (extracted from the catalog iirc).  If possible to correct the caching mechanism to also support setting managment_url which would prevent the need of requesting the token (in the first place) to get the catalog and endpoints.

Please look into, and see if it is possible to handle caching the management_url if the token caching is used.  this will also help to streamline the requests and lighten the need to ask keystone for information if the information is already available."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-08-03 04:04:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

To actually fix the issue of throwing out valid tokens I would like to see this patch fix the os-cache option.  And then if it works well for everyone we can try to make it the default setting later on.


So currently the keychain based token cache is disabled by default, and does not work.

To enable it use the '--os-cache' option. And you the API calls with the '--timing' option.

The keychain code is found in novaclient.shell.SecretsHelper

This change http://paste.openstack.org/show/43015/ made os-cache work (hit by the same bug as the one here).  The only thing that doesn't work with that patch is getting a new token when the old one expires.  After a quick glance it looks like keystoneclient has similar logic, perhaps theirs already handles expired tokens properly."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-08-03 19:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
if we have a valid auth token, use it instead of generating a new one

If authenticating with a valid token (i.e., token auth, not
username/password auth), novaclient would instruct keystone to issue
a new token with an identical expiry to the one used, and pivot
onto it.  This makes it appear as though Nova is leaking Keystone
tokens.

Since there's zero benefit to issuing a new token that is ostensibly
identical to the perfectly good token used to authenticate, make
novaclient keep using the token it already has after successful
validation, and not issue a new one.

This patch set adds a new pair of tests to the
AuthenticateAgainstKeystoneTests class, which parrot the current
authentication pass/fail tests, but exercise the new code paths

Also adds a fix by Joe Gordon to make os_cache work correctly.

Change-Id: Ic4f0e6d506d8d81f0b1d46138e7e19d3b3392e1d
Fixes: Bug 1197201
Related-Bug: 1214658

commit_message:
[WIP] Adds a new table TaskInfo

The fields input, message and result which are Text so, are moved to a
separate table. Also, made db api changes as needed.

partly implements bp async-glance-workers

Change-Id: I584a5fe16b62a1e2a8250013fbe133a3134e6931

commit_message:
Fix RequestContext.to_dict user/username inconsistency

The username value should be returned, not the self.user value,
otherwise you unexpectedly get inconsistent results if you ever
override the username after creating the object.  Some tests
added, one of which illustrates the problem.

Change-Id: I95e416e3046607d8b0406812705949e8ff464f86
Closes-Bug: #1237459

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-02 08:22:08.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure tranfers table charset is UTF-8

This prevents MySQL from reporting foreign key errors at table creation because
volumes table already uses utf-8 whereas the default charset for new tables
seems to be latin1.

Change-Id: Ifb6a594201a8075ecb7655c6978f09b346959a93
Closes-Bug: #1233861
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure tranfers table charset is UTF-8

This prevents MySQL from reporting foreign key errors at table creation because
volumes table already uses utf-8 whereas the default charset for new tables
seems to be latin1.

Change-Id: Ifb6a594201a8075ecb7655c6978f09b346959a93
Closes-Bug: #1233861

to a dictionary and attempt to restore that exception,

used to interact with the traceback module.

Inspired by: http://bit.ly/18YiqDQ (twisted version)

It has the same issue where we can not rethrow a traceback type
so after restoring the failure we will be unable to throw the
original traceback, although our 'fake' traceback can be used
with the existing traceback python module and we can rethrow the
restored type and object.

commit_message:
Add basic failure save and restore

Make it possible to save a failures components
to a dictionary and attempt to restore that exception,
exception type and a 'fake' traceback that can later be
used to interact with the traceback module.

Inspired by: http://bit.ly/18YiqDQ (twisted version)

It has the same issue where we can not rethrow a traceback type
so after restoring the failure we will be unable to throw the
original traceback, although our 'fake' traceback can be used
with the existing traceback python module and we can rethrow the
restored type and object.

Change-Id: Iae7e3ddef8542b6fa35563b54f50a4577b14b8b1

commit_message:
Ensure combination alarm evaluator can be loaded

Fixes bug 1237578

Previously combination alarms were always skipped as the evaluator
was missing from the loadable stevedore extensions.

Change-Id: I9d164fb2a89ee9931fc032d93ad4a26ba6887f0b

commit_message:
Add quota table in PLUMgrid plugin

Quota DB driver is enabled in Neutron by default.
PLUMgrid plugin was missing the "quota" table. It has
been added in this commit.

Fix bug# 1236970

Change-Id: I5170a8be2b412a3bcf1edcacce5574f0073b84d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 14:55:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add a route to reach the MD server when a subnet is created

When the first subnet is created, the dhcp port is created and
midonet plugin correctly adds the static route to reach the MD
server in create_port. When a second or following subnets are
created, a new ip is added to the dhcp port. This patch takes
care of adding the static route to correcly reach the MD server
in update_port. This fixes the problem of VMs not being able to
reach the MD if assigned to the second subnet

Closes-bug: #1231914
Change-Id: Ifc95f901d4222b76a4254e21295829ac8d82493b
(cherry picked from commit 3568a9cac73a2da19e86d82f561be10ae9dbe9a0)
'}]
commit_message:
Add a route to reach the MD server when a subnet is created

When the first subnet is created, the dhcp port is created and
midonet plugin correctly adds the static route to reach the MD
server in create_port. When a second or following subnets are
created, a new ip is added to the dhcp port. This patch takes
care of adding the static route to correcly reach the MD server
in update_port. This fixes the problem of VMs not being able to
reach the MD if assigned to the second subnet

Closes-bug: #1231914
Change-Id: Ifc95f901d4222b76a4254e21295829ac8d82493b
(cherry picked from commit 3568a9cac73a2da19e86d82f561be10ae9dbe9a0)

commit_message:
add support to ignore certain request

the amount of GET requests may create a large amount of traffic
on the notification bus. users may want the ability to ignore GET
(or other) requests to alleviate the load if requests are not of
interest. adding an ignore_req_list filter option to accommodate
this.

Change-Id: I840c43bf3fcaca28dd20cdf9b8c0787fce732f69

commit_message:
Remove obsolete redhat-eventlet.patch

The gorey details for why this exists is in the commit message for
commit 3c132c0.

As of this fix:

  https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/pull/34

which was released in eventlet 0.13, we no longer need the patch.

Change-Id: I84267f3c6726cb2e750f615e107c48b12c6ed353

So the lock fixture should probably be first if you want the entire test method (including any other fixtures) to be in the lock context. addCleanup() is a LIFO queue which gets run after tearDown (or on an exception, or test failure) so calling the lock fixture first ensures that the lock will be removed last.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-10-04 17:41:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Add LockFixture to lockutils

This commit adds a fixture class to be used instead of external
locking with the synchronized decorator. When running tests in
parallel the synchronized decorator won't synchronize the tearDown
and addCleanup methods for a test. By using the fixture which does
LockFixture the unlocking is done by using addCleanup() ensuring that
tearDown and later addCleanup methods are run inside the lock
context.

Closes-Bug: #1229437

Change-Id: I61af5e9d385bb7ef2e6402366fb8c5c09f749986

commit_message:
Add verbose output to all stat commands

When you stat a container or object with the verbose flag the full path of the
reousrce will be displayed with the token similarlly to how an account stat
displays the auth url and token.

 * move some logic out of bin/swift.st_stat to test it
 * new module swiftclient.commnad_helpers for code you want to test
 * moved prt_bytes into swiftclient.utils to test it
 * fixed IndexError with prt_bytes on sizes >= 1024Y

Change-Id: I1a29a09d39112d39eeae3071d89ad3bc41ec3b39

  12 translated languages are avaialable.
* Russian (ru) and Chinese Taiwan (zh_tw) newly completed their
  translations since RC1. They are added to the language list.
* Update POT files

This commit is directly proposed to milestone-proposed branch
because the master branch is already opened for Icehouse development
and the translatable strings are no longer same as those in Havana.

I believe it is the final import.

Change-Id: I9e8e7c28fae64f1aad7fbd5f226910fb9ee6a325
Closes-Bug: #1234317
'}]
commit_message:
Import translations for Havana release

* Import translation update of 100% completed languages.
  12 translated languages are avaialable.
* Russian (ru) and Chinese Taiwan (zh_tw) newly completed their
  translations since RC1. They are added to the language list.
* Update POT files

This commit is directly proposed to milestone-proposed branch
because the master branch is already opened for Icehouse development
and the translatable strings are no longer same as those in Havana.

I believe it is the final import.

Change-Id: I9e8e7c28fae64f1aad7fbd5f226910fb9ee6a325
Closes-Bug: #1234317

We can't simply pass the None default on to the read operation as this
default is handled differently between different wsgi implementations.

Change-Id: I337e797b8dee3dfcf9299fe361cf197a176c8fe2
Fixes: bug 1213106

commit_message:
Don't use default value in LimitingReader

We can't simply pass the None default on to the read operation as this
default is handled differently between different wsgi implementations.

Change-Id: I337e797b8dee3dfcf9299fe361cf197a176c8fe2
Fixes: bug 1213106

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 15:15:23.000000000', 'message': 'NEC plugin: Fix nec-agent unexpected exit due to RPC exception

Changes nec-agent to catch RPC exceptions in the main
daemon loop. It fixes the following two bugs.

- nec-agent dies with RPC timeout in secgroup RPC
  (Closes-Bug: #1235106)

- port_added message can be dropped when RPC timeout occurs
  (Closes-Bug: #1235111). Moves exception catch from PluginApi
  to the main daemon loop.

Change-Id: I12394b739fc35bff271543f4625c5e3152e534ae
(cherry picked from commit 3df505e448d38929c20721b22d81e47bf917af6a)
'}, {'created': '2013-10-08 15:15:23.000000000', 'message': 'NEC plugin: Fix nec-agent unexpected exit due to RPC exception

Changes nec-agent to catch RPC exceptions in the main
daemon loop. It fixes the following two bugs.

- nec-agent dies with RPC timeout in secgroup RPC
  (Closes-Bug: #1235106)

- port_added message can be dropped when RPC timeout occurs
  (Closes-Bug: #1235111). Moves exception catch from PluginApi
  to the main daemon loop.

Change-Id: I12394b739fc35bff271543f4625c5e3152e534ae
(cherry picked from commit 3df505e448d38929c20721b22d81e47bf917af6a)
'}]
commit_message:
NEC plugin: Fix nec-agent unexpected exit due to RPC exception

Changes nec-agent to catch RPC exceptions in the main
daemon loop. It fixes the following two bugs.

- nec-agent dies with RPC timeout in secgroup RPC
  (Closes-Bug: #1235106)

- port_added message can be dropped when RPC timeout occurs
  (Closes-Bug: #1235111). Moves exception catch from PluginApi
  to the main daemon loop.

Change-Id: I12394b739fc35bff271543f4625c5e3152e534ae
(cherry picked from commit 3df505e448d38929c20721b22d81e47bf917af6a)

[{'created': '2013-10-09 20:46:33.000000000', 'message': "Wait 10 minutes for keystone DB patching.

It takes more time than we were waiting for keystone to be usable, and
as it's unpredictable, lets allow a longer window.

Change-Id: Icce8c7d897c43780cbccab3e845ea8e471d5d6a8
"}]
commit_message:
Wait 10 minutes for keystone DB patching.

It takes more time than we were waiting for keystone to be usable, and
as it's unpredictable, lets allow a longer window.

Change-Id: Icce8c7d897c43780cbccab3e845ea8e471d5d6a8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 11:40:41.000000000', 'message': "Remove nested 'ipmi' dict from driver_info

driver_info do not support nested objects. Self-namespace will be used
to distinguish parameters from one driver to another.

Change-Id: Ia720fac4b60aa0aa18406e0ba61d8a0a8c5c8a78
Partial-Bug: #1236533
"}]
commit_message:
Remove nested 'ipmi' dict from driver_info

driver_info do not support nested objects. Self-namespace will be used
to distinguish parameters from one driver to another.

Change-Id: Ia720fac4b60aa0aa18406e0ba61d8a0a8c5c8a78
Partial-Bug: #1236533

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-05 15:51:12.000000000', 'message': "config_helper.py doesn't handle int/float value correctly

Two issues for _initialise_configs function:
1. If value is a negative integer, it won't be parsed as integer
2. If value is a float, the function take it as a string by wrong.

Change-Id: I08ca62c577ddda5083e08391b0693455d6ca68dc
Close-bug: #1235702

commit_message:
config_helper.py doesn't handle negative int correctly

The check-in is supposed to fix bug 1235702.

But handling float parameters takes much more tests,
thus we leave this part for later.

Partially Close-bug: #1235702
Change-Id: I08ca62c577ddda5083e08391b0693455d6ca68dc

commit_message:
Policy file paths on osfamily=RedHat have changed

On RedHat distributions of OpenStack (i.e. Fedora, RDO and RHOS),
the path of the RBAC policy files has been changed to differ from
upstream as they strive to have all configuration pieces under
/etc/openstack-dashboard instead of /usr/share/openstack-dashboard/

This change merely mimics the change Red Hat performed downstream:
https://github.com/redhat-openstack/horizon/commit/76e15a3cd419a0038b44687effec95b41e656d79

Change-Id: Ib1692244fed6191af84af0123c78129d71991a41

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 14:44:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix possible race issue with test_engine_service

There's the potential for racy behavior in test_show_watch, because
the result of show_watch(self.ctx, watch_name=None) is all watches
visible to the user, not only those for a specific stack.  So it's
possible that the result length will be more than two, and since the
watch name is also not unique, we could see spurious test failures.

So make the test assertions more specific, and avoid reusing the same
watch name in test_show_watch_metric.

Change-Id: Ibb1cbae04dee4b6c4ada44336143fd122a3cb53f
Closes-Bug: #1237324
"}, {'created': '2013-10-09 16:04:08.000000000', 'message': "Fix possible race issue with test_engine_service

There's the potential for racy behavior in test_show_watch, because
the result of show_watch(self.ctx, watch_name=None) is all watches
visible to the user, not only those for a specific stack.  So it's
possible that the result length will be more than two, and since the
watch name is also not unique, we could see spurious test failures.

So make the test assertions more specific, and avoid reusing the same
watch name in test_show_watch_metric.

Change-Id: Ibb1cbae04dee4b6c4ada44336143fd122a3cb53f
Closes-Bug: #1237324
"}]
commit_message:
Fix possible race issue with test_engine_service

There's the potential for racy behavior in test_show_watch, because
the result of show_watch(self.ctx, watch_name=None) is all watches
visible to the user, not only those for a specific stack.  So it's
possible that the result length will be more than two, and since the
watch name is also not unique, we could see spurious test failures.

So make the test assertions more specific, and avoid reusing the same
watch name in test_show_watch_metric.

Change-Id: Ibb1cbae04dee4b6c4ada44336143fd122a3cb53f
Closes-Bug: #1237324

commit_message:
Fix the signal details string

This could come from multiple places so try make it useful in the
common case (Ceilometer and watchrule) and safe in the other cases.

Change-Id: Iee88968b52ec15addf4721e004d2994b2f8c2134
Closes-bug: #1224434

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-28 12:18:41.000000000', 'message': "py33: don't encode security_group

In Python 3, str and bytes can not be mixed. str.encode() will
return bytes in py33, which will induce the mismatch.

Bypass the s.name.encode() in py33.

Change-Id: Iee8d69aab9df4af126e94e4363f79e32fdd70fcd
Close-bug: #1231868
"}]
commit_message:
py33: don't encode security_group

In Python 3, str and bytes can not be mixed. str.encode() will
return bytes in py33, which will induce the mismatch.

Bypass the s.name.encode() in py33.

Change-Id: Iee8d69aab9df4af126e94e4363f79e32fdd70fcd
Close-bug: #1231868

commit_message:
Windows instances require the timezone to be "localtime"

This was relatively simple to fix, assuming that the image used
to boot the windows instance has the os_type set to "windows".
The use of os_type in this manner is consistent with the
existing use in the Xen hypervisor driver.

DocImpact: if you're booting windows instances, then you need to
set the os_type image property in glance to "windows". Otherwise
your instances will have their clock timezone set to UTC, which
has unexpected side effects in windows.

Change-Id: Id6759a290ed25c9add97ac61bb7d165b3fb908b2
Closes-Bug: 1231254
(cherry picked from commit 280a336a07006b2c998719f2f9033d43289ec7ef)

commit_message:
Improve default logging configuration

By default, a number of serious exceptions were not being
logged. Adding a logger for 'django'-related logs resolves this.

Also:
 - Add loggers for missing clients and django_openstack_auth
 - Add a default level for individual loggers (what makes it out to
   the log file remains determined by the handler configuration)

Change-Id: Id3478ac8ec79f22c19ef66e747f3701f98a36611
Closes-Bug: #1236423

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 18:42:43.000000000', 'message': 'horizon is removing the URL path from glance's endpoint

Autor: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Glanceclient removes the API version from the endpoint in case it exists. Look the following code:

https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/shell.py#L310

    def _strip_version(self, endpoint):
        """Strip version from the last component of endpoint if present."""

        # Get rid of trailing '/' if present
        if endpoint.endswith('/'):
            endpoint = endpoint[:-1]
        url_bits = endpoint.split('/')
        # regex to match 'v1' or 'v2.0' etc
        if re.match('v\d+\.?\d*', url_bits[-1]):
            endpoint = '/'.join(url_bits[:-1])
        return endpoint

The rest of code includes the API version in use accordingly.

Change-Id: If896b8793095c4c23569b482497bf9d886170b2b
'}]
commit_message:
horizon is removing the URL path from glance's endpoint

Autor: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Glanceclient removes the API version from the endpoint in case it exists. Look the following code:

https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/shell.py#L310

    def _strip_version(self, endpoint):
        """Strip version from the last component of endpoint if present."""

        # Get rid of trailing '/' if present
        if endpoint.endswith('/'):
            endpoint = endpoint[:-1]
        url_bits = endpoint.split('/')
        # regex to match 'v1' or 'v2.0' etc
        if re.match('v\d+\.?\d*', url_bits[-1]):
            endpoint = '/'.join(url_bits[:-1])
        return endpoint

The rest of code includes the API version in use accordingly.

Change-Id: If896b8793095c4c23569b482497bf9d886170b2b

In order to use the multi-threaded engine
which takes an executor as input for projects
which have not eventlet monkey patched the

Change-Id: Ida9ce6183471ad6b323a3c9ca863561699e32ddc
'}, {'created': '2013-10-06 02:50:51.000000000', 'message': 'Create a eventlet executor & futures

In order to use the multi-threaded engine
which takes an executor as input for projects
which have not eventlet monkey patched the
threading module we can create a eventlet
compatible executor and future objects which
can work with the same multi-threaded engine
for projects which use eventlet.

This executor also works in natively threaded
applications by correctly altering the future
condition attribute to use a greened condition,
which is required to make sure that green threads
run when the condition is waited on.

Part of blueprint eventlet-engine

blueprint eventlet-engine

Change-Id: Ida9ce6183471ad6b323a3c9ca863561699e32ddc
'}, {'created': '2013-10-06 03:39:22.000000000', 'message': 'Create a eventlet executor & futures

In order to use the multi-threaded engine
which takes an executor as input for projects
which have *not* eventlet monkey patched the
threading module we provide a eventlet
compatible executor and future objects which
can work with the same multi-threaded engine
for projects which use eventlet.

This executor also works in natively threaded
applications by correctly altering the future
condition attribute to use a greened condition,

commit_message:
Create a green executor & green future

In order to use the multi-threaded engine
which takes an executor as input for projects
which have *not* eventlet monkey patched the
threading module we provide a eventlet
compatible executor and future objects which
can work with the same multi-threaded engine.

This executor also works in natively threaded
applications by correctly altering the future
condition attribute to use a greened condition,
which is required to make sure that greenthreads
run when the condition is waited on.

blueprint eventlet-engine

Change-Id: Ida9ce6183471ad6b323a3c9ca863561699e32ddc

commit_message:
Add state to dot->svg tool

Add a helper tool that can convert the
allowed state transitions into a dot graph
which itself then converts it into a browser
compatible svg file, which can then be looked
at to have a pretty state diagram.

Change-Id: I3cbbc75bd58182700ddc07f00395da5d1093a26c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-30 13:44:55.000000000', 'message': '_get_log_file_path is incorrect, when logfile and logdire unset

Some change for tempest/openstack/common/log.py:_get_log_file_path:

[{'created': '2013-10-08 21:29:13.000000000', 'message': 'library six minimum version must be specified

Some modules in Ceilometer uses library six and uses method add_metaclass,
however, that only existed in six 1.3.0 and above. The ceilometer
requirements.txt should be updated to reflect that.

Change-Id: Idbc0653784b4dd0bbdd7bd0b0cb4705e497b5991
fixes: bug# 1237089

commit_message:
library six minimum version must be specified

Some modules in Ceilometer uses library six and uses method add_metaclass,
however, that only existed in six 1.3.0 and above. The ceilometer
requirements.txt should be updated to reflect that.

Change-Id: Idbc0653784b4dd0bbdd7bd0b0cb4705e497b5991
fixes: bug# 1237089

I disagree with the change.  SAN is a physical configuration of storage devices.  NFS is the file system protocol.  So, NFS is independent of the type of storage device.  It is not either/or, but more "SAN or NAS" implementing NFS.  It is a detail that makes sense to storage engineers, but looks wrong to the general reader.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2013-10-09 18:59:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Reverted

This patchset was reverted in change: I13aecf5942ef49d5c7c78bb3d30a79d41897a9f5'}, {'account_id': 8434, 'date': '2013-10-09 19:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks!  Yeah, TLAs spread confusion.  When I first read this, I thought the same, but eventually got what the developer was really saying.'}]

[{'created': '2013-10-09 07:25:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix last commit using "of" instead of "or"

Change-Id: Icf8d39173c4f70d0d7234a31c0ad10dffca929bc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix last commit using "of" instead of "or"

It's SAN or NFS - not SAN of NFS, a recent commit
broke this.

Change-Id: Icf8d39173c4f70d0d7234a31c0ad10dffca929bc

commit_message:
module six needs to be updated to at least 1.3.0

module six earlier version (less than 1.3.0) does not have add_metaclass
project ceilometer needs to use these methods. So the update is needed.

Change-Id: Ibba3288b255604d04413d65d287696b720ee1a2a

commit_message:
Fix incorrect exception raised during evacuate

This change creates a new exception 'ComputeServiceInUse'
to better represent the error when trying to evacuate
an instance with a running compute service. Also, it adds
a missing test for evacuate API v3.

Closes-Bug: #1230282

Change-Id: I1c4edb01e84cd2a89879bca9c99f5e38f47e16fb

commit_message:
Make tripleo-cd use local stackrc

We can't deploy without these bits. Note that this is just a stop-gap
until we can configure these settings via Heat.

Change-Id: Iccfeeae6002b66c3e80bab33874a413aad262e3f

subject: reuse existing resources-initial working prototype
messages: [{'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-10-02 16:28:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)\n\nSeveral pep8 issues; also, I think the approach is a little too intrusive. It looks to me as if every single resource would have to be updated to account for these new environment properties. I think it would be less intrusive to add some info to a resource in the resource section that indicates that it has a resource_id and weather or not create is complete. Then, resource.py create can be modified to examine this information from the environment and call or not call methods of the resource implementation as appropriate. This means we wouldn't have to modify any existing resources and new resources would get this capability automatically."}, {'account_id': 7230, 'date': '2013-10-03 14:47:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7230, 'date': '2013-10-03 14:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7230, 'date': '2013-10-03 15:05:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7230, 'date': '2013-10-09 18:46:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7230, 'date': '2013-10-09 18:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 7230, 'date': '2013-10-09 18:55:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 7230, 'date': '2013-10-09 18:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Restored'}, {'account_id': 7230, 'date': '2013-10-09 18:57:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 15:11:01.000000000', 'message': "BigSwitch: sync state on disassociate floating ip

Sends the state of port's parent network to the backend controller
when a floating IP is disassociated from a port.

Closes-Bug: #1235074
Change-Id: I8375e6564b5d08f1adc7e7aef6affc97c8d03c5e
(cherry picked from commit 0bae949eed229613c77c4943edbf68c1c140f977)
"}]
commit_message:
BigSwitch: sync state on disassociate floating ip

Sends the state of port's parent network to the backend controller
when a floating IP is disassociated from a port.

Closes-Bug: #1235074
Change-Id: I8375e6564b5d08f1adc7e7aef6affc97c8d03c5e
(cherry picked from commit 0bae949eed229613c77c4943edbf68c1c140f977)

[{'created': '2013-10-09 17:47:31.000000000', 'message': 'Import translations for Havana release

* Import translation update of 100% completed languages.
  12 translated languages are avaialable.
* Russian (ru) and Chinese Taiwan (zh_tw) newly completed their
  translations since RC1. They are added to the language list.
* Update POT files

This commit is directly proposed to milestone-proposed branch
because the master branch is already opened for Icehouse development
and the translatable strings are no longer same as those in Havana.

I believe it is the final import.

Change-Id: I9e8e7c28fae64f1aad7fbd5f226910fb9ee6a325
Closes-Bug: #1234317
'}]
commit_message:
Import translations for Havana release

* Import translation update of 100% completed languages.
  12 translated languages are avaialable.
* Russian (ru) and Chinese Taiwan (zh_tw) newly completed their
  translations since RC1. They are added to the language list.
* Update POT files

This commit is directly proposed to milestone-proposed branch
because the master branch is already opened for Icehouse development
and the translatable strings are no longer same as those in Havana.

I believe it is the final import.

Change-Id: I9e8e7c28fae64f1aad7fbd5f226910fb9ee6a325
Closes-Bug: #1234317

[{'created': '2013-09-11 06:23:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the unused mapper of image member create

For image members v1, we don't support "create" method,
but we're mapping it in router.py. So this fix will
remove the unused mapper.

Fixes bug 1223658

Change-Id: I20401656ea2930a026cf8b67825d9ec9f6623487
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the unused mapper of image member create

For image members v1, we don't support "create" method,
but we're mapping it in router.py. So this fix will
remove the unused mapper.

Fixes bug 1223658

Change-Id: I20401656ea2930a026cf8b67825d9ec9f6623487

And I like the approach in PS4 and change it with flwang's suggestion."}, {'account_id': 6981, 'date': '2013-09-26 08:02:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@zhiyan,

I am curious why JSB mentioned below,

An example would be absolute redirects. Suppose the endpoint_url is http://glance.openstack.org , but then we 302 redirect to https://glance.openstack.org

That comes out as this (as I recall): http://glance.openstack.org/https://glance.openstack.org

Why posixpath.normpath() could result in the output above. As we know self.endpoint_path is parsed by urlparse, so the value can not be http://glance.openstack.org/. And url comes from API layer, I went through all codes, it always looks like '/v1/images/detail'.

So can you explain to me why this result came out? Thank you so much."}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-09-26 09:21:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Yang Yu, the key is common/http.py line #241, that means _http_request() will be recursive called if glance server side return 301, 302 or 305. And under this situation, the 'url' argument will contains _new_ endpoint prefix path, so JSB's change using urlparse.urljoin() to handle this situation but using string contact basically.

for example:

>>> url = urlparse.urljoin('http://glance.openstack.org/', 'https://glance.openstack.org/v1/images/details')
>>> urlparse.urlsplit(url).geturl()
'https://glance.openstack.org/v1/images/details'"}, {'account_id': 6981, 'date': '2013-09-26 14:23:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6981, 'date': '2013-09-26 14:32:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Zhi Yan,

Thank you for your nice illustration. I know why JSB make this fix more clear. But I did not change the code like feilong and you mentioned because it also result in problem. Actually, we the _http_request is called recursively, we can not use the "%s/%s" % (self.endpoint_path, url) to get valid url. For example, if self.endpoint_path is '/test' and url from recursive procedure is 'https://example.com:9292/v1', "%s/%s" % (self.endpoint_path, url) would be '/test/https://example.com:9292/v1', so it still is not a valid url.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-09-26 15:12:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGit#Test_Failures

"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2013-09-26 15:22:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The looks good. Just some minor inline comments."}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-09-26 15:42:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

@Yang Yu, Oh sorry for my above solution I just forgot to update it. Please check my inline comments.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-09-26 16:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

This looks like an important fix. Sorry for the regression. I should have pushed more for unit tests during the change that caused it.

However, "redirect" is a bit too specific to this problem and makes the code feel a bit hacky.

How about instead, we add an optional "endpoint_path" keyword argument to the method in question. The passed endpoint_path parameter, if not None, would override self.endpoint_path.

In the case of a redirect, we can parse out the endpoint path if its in response['location'] and pass it into the recursion.'}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-09-26 16:40:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

ok if so, as markwash thought, then I consider we should landing follow two related bug also:

Fix getting header in redirect processing
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/48481/

Fix default value for a header
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/48480/"}, {'account_id': 6981, 'date': '2013-09-27 05:15:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6981, 'date': '2013-09-27 05:17:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6981, 'date': '2013-09-27 05:23:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@Mark, @Fei Long, @Zhi Yan

Thank you for all your comments. I have fixed it and submit a new patch. Please review again.

@Mark,

I did not change the code as what you mentioned because I think the suggestion from Zhi Yan is better, it does not modify the current interface, it just checks whether url is whole or not, I think that is enough. Actually, the url from API layer is just the URI like '/v1/images/detail', but the one from recursion is a whole location like 'https://example.com:9292/v1/images/detail'. If you still have any concern, welcome to tell me. Thank you so much."}, {'account_id': 6549, 'date': '2013-09-27 05:33:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Fix regression bug after removing posixpath in http.py

After removing posixpath.normpath(url) in http.py, the code has a
regression bug that the url like 'http://example.com:80/test' can
not work. The code urlparse.urljoin() can not work as '%s%s' %
(self.endpoint_path, url).

Fixes bug #1230032

Change-Id: Ie7266fc3a067b92dfeed169086b4bf6a87dedbd6

[{'created': '2013-09-26 15:45:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix getting header in redirect processing

The code for processing an HTTP redirect included an incorrect method of
getting the Location header from an HTTPResponse.  It needs to use the
getheader() method on the response, instead.  This patch fixes that and
includes a unit test that covers this code path.

Change-Id: I0952fabad581b020dee07bdc4007b55b47c906aa
Closes-Bug: #1231524
'}]
commit_message:
Fix getting header in redirect processing

The code for processing an HTTP redirect included an incorrect method of
getting the Location header from an HTTPResponse.  It needs to use the
getheader() method on the response, instead.  This patch fixes that and
includes a unit test that covers this code path.

Change-Id: I0952fabad581b020dee07bdc4007b55b47c906aa
Closes-Bug: #1231524

oslo context is deprecated now, see: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1210261 (which is reported by me, sorry for the ads)

the reason is that, many project maintain its own context which doesn't not depends on oslo, you can see this in glance.context

and for the latest master branch:
glance$ egrep 'from glance.openstack.common import context' ./ -r
./openstack/common/notifier/rpc_notifier.py:from glance.openstack.common import context as req_context
./openstack/common/notifier/rpc_notifier2.py:from glance.openstack.common import context as req_context
./openstack/common/notifier/api.py:from glance.openstack.common import context

so this sync is not needed."}, {'account_id': 6676, 'date': '2013-10-09 14:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

i think you can fix the always return delted image problem in glance.context directly, since i'm planning to remove the openstack.common.context module from oslo, (and from glance too)


def _can_show_deleted(context): in glance.db.sqlalchemy.api uses 

    if hasattr(context, 'show_deleted'):
        return context.show_deleted

while in glance.context

    @property
    def show_deleted(self):
        """Admins can see deleted by default"""
        if self._show_deleted or self.is_admin:
            return True
        return False

so , if context is admin, it always return true, not because the 'no'!=False prolem'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-09 15:24:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Sync context code from oslo

In old glance.openstack.common.RequestContext.get_admin_context(), the
default value of its 'show_deleted' argument is 'no'. This caused admin
context 'show_deleted' field is 'no' not False, and
glance.db.sqlalchemy.api just check that value as a boolean value, but
in python 'no' != False we know. So under this situation
glance.db.sqlalchemy.api._image_get will always return deleted image
entry.

Change-Id: I8f68f5a4bb453f8df4f6b2ad056b860d448e92f8
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

we are discussing offline, thanks for the heads up!'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-07-05 16:52:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(2 inline comments)

this patch obviously goes well beyond the scope of the cited bug, and appears to fix/test the issue described in the second bug as well (which I still don't know how to reproduce against keystone). i prefer the fix here though, mostly for utilizing timeutils instead of introducing a dep on pytz. if the test in the second review isn't covered here, i'd suggest that test be rebased on top of this patch"}, {'account_id': 6949, 'date': '2013-07-05 19:17:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

In my testing I found strftime('%s') is dependent on the host machine's timezone setting. Since the return value of confirm_token_not_expired is derived using strftime() and used for caching purposes we need to make sure this is accurate.

In other words, time.time() != float(timeutils.normalize_time(timeutils.utcnow()).strftime('%s')) in all timezones. The good news is time.time() == calendar.timegm(timeutils.normalize_time(timeutils.utcnow()).timetuple()) in all timezones. I'm finishing up a patch to submit soon. Also, this thankfully doesn't require the external dependency to pytz.

This does assume the machine running the Keystone middleware and the memcache server used by the middleware are running in the same timezone but I believe that's a safe assumption."}, {'account_id': 6949, 'date': '2013-07-05 19:21:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2013-07-05 19:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I might be missing something here but i don't see how this really changes the expiry condition.

We went from comparing two UTC times to comparing two TZ normalized times, which will be the same result."}, {'account_id': 5733, 'date': '2013-07-25 02:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

I initially blamed time.time(), but it appears that strftime() assumes local time, and subtracts the tz offset so the value returned is in "UTC". This means calling it on a UTC datetime gives you incorrect output if the server time is not UTC.

https://gist.github.com/conkiztador/6076371

The tests in this patch imply that the timestamp from the original Keystone token may be a non-UTC date, but I don't think that report was ever confirmed. I certainly didn't see that during my testing.'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2013-07-25 03:32:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (2 inline comments)

@Jamie : we are trying to compare the two timestamps which might not hace the offset value after applying strftime(). Also, some comments inline.

@Kieran,  Jamie : the original token from keystone could have an offset of the timezone and is resulting into token invalidation issues in some cases.'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2013-07-25 03:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

@Kieran: thanks for the awesome gist btw!'}, {'account_id': 6949, 'date': '2013-07-26 17:58:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 6949, 'date': '2013-07-26 18:14:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

My testing and Kieran's excellent explanation and gist show we should avoid strftime(). nikhil's latest patch still depends on strftime (via timeutils.strtime(), line 265).

This patch changes the return value of confirm_token_not_expired() to an ISO 8601 datetime string as opposed to a Unix timestamp. This also means memcache will store the expiration time as an ISO 8601 string instead of a Unix timestamp.

In summary, now we're using ISO 8601 UTC time throughout the stack and avoiding an unnecessary conversion to a Unix timestamp."}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2013-07-26 18:28:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

good catch Bryan, and thanks for the explanation!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-26 19:30:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Normalize datetimes to account for tz

This patch makes sure that datetimes in the auth_token middleware
are normalized to account for timezone offsets.

Some of the old tests were changed to ensure that the expires string
stored in the cache is in ISO 8601 format and not a random float.

Fixes bug 1195924

Change-Id: I5917ab728193cd2aa8784c4860a96cdc17f3d43f

commit_message:
Utilizes assertIn

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIn
which was created for these types of tests.

Fixes bug #1230028

Change-Id: I8a9147fa9982644067ff45c73e116d88845e47e3

commit_message:
Upstream changed default quota_driver

For Neutron Havana-rc2, the default quota_driver has been changed
to a more sensible value. Also, Horizon (and possible others) now
expects this quota_driver and will show errors if set otherwise.

See also the upstream bug and change:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1189671
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/50378/

Change-Id: I47bd2fe8aa29614f1eaf15b9a2063883bb17d0e6

commit_message:
Fix performance issues for DB API

Two methods were using iterators for filtering out queries while
SQLAlchemy directly offers possibility to filter natively with strong
performance impact.

Change-Id: I1d03a89f71db06b0b2aeb9ff006fa7115ed7a8ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-01 13:54:01.000000000', 'message': "Enable unittest on 32-bit system

Many of the tokens shipped in the test suite are set to expire in
2112. If running the test suite on a 32-bit platform, it will
fail, as the timestamps can't fit in 32 bits.

Actually, for token validation, there is no need to check seconds,
we can use datetime object comparison directly to avoid 2038
problem for 32-bit system.

NOTE: This patch just enables running unittest, the root cause is
that token memcache stores expire time in seconds instead of
timestamp string. This will cause further problem which is not
covered by unittest yet, and since many unittest code use this
feature, it is not suitable to fix them in this patch.

NOTE: No unittest is added for this change because it is not
testable since Jenkins is using 64-bit system.

Closes-Bug: #1190054
Change-Id: I395cabe4c2c7f186ac8bf2c8f4181bc2f923b089
"}]
commit_message:
Enable unittest on 32-bit system

Many of the tokens shipped in the test suite are set to expire in
2112. If running the test suite on a 32-bit platform, it will
fail, as the timestamps can't fit in 32 bits.

Actually, for token validation, there is no need to check seconds,
we can use datetime object comparison directly to avoid 2038
problem for 32-bit system.

NOTE: This patch just enables running unittest, the root cause is
that token memcache stores expire time in seconds instead of
timestamp string. This will cause further problem which is not
covered by unittest yet, and since many unittest code use this
feature, it is not suitable to fix them in this patch.

NOTE: No unittest is added for this change because it is not
testable since Jenkins is using 64-bit system.

Closes-Bug: #1190054
Change-Id: I395cabe4c2c7f186ac8bf2c8f4181bc2f923b089

commit_message:
Replaces mox with mock for ssh driver unit tests

OpenStack is moving to use mock instead of mox for unit tests
in order to be ready for python 3. This patch changes the
test cases for ssh driver from using mox to mock.

Change-Id: Ida19bf698fb7e97f122b81a1783882f879e0aeb2
Closes-Bug: 1229397

commit_message:
Glance manage should parse glance-api.conf

glance-manage does not currently parse glance-api.conf, when
glance-registry.conf is present. Currently it's parsed conditionally.
But, when some configs from glance-api.conf are required, we would
need parse them both.
eg. CONF.swift_store_user, CONF.swift_store_key in glance-api.conf

Fixes bug #1225863

Change-Id: I553c1bb460229489b38a57d9c91995816bfe09ee

commit_message:
VMware: Config Drive Support

Create the config drive iso, upload it to the correct location,
then create a VirtualMachineConfigSpec with appropriate contents
and run the ReconfigVM_Task to enable the iso.

DocImpact

Fixes LP# 1206584
Fixes BP vmware-config-drive-support

(cherry picked from commit 3c59d998c5e6b80549053b01f919ac318cd31b13)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/test_vmwareapi_vm_util.py
	nova/tests/vmwareapi/db_fakes.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/fake.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: Ie39c71cf7b0dccb71340b5bf8871d5e086576f4d

Fei,
I would like to add to what Mark said. You make a very good analogy about the pizza :p
So the reason why I agree with Mark and feel that Factory is not responsible for check is that the Factory is responsible for just creating image members, it has no connection with ImageMember repos. It creates the image members irrespective of which ImageMember repo they would go into. 
ImageMemberFactory may create members for ImageMember Repo A or repo B. But when we are adding the member to the repo, that is when you can perform the check to see if the member exists in that given repo.
Going back to the pizza example, this is an example of single responsibility. As a pizza cook, I will cook pizza for every order I get. It is not my responsibility to get worried if I get orders for two same pizzas - they might be from two different customers or it might be a mistake and the order from same customer might have been repeated. It is the responsibility of the person managing the pizzas to ensure the tickets are correct and delivered to right person."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2013-09-29 13:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2013-09-29 14:30:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Do not allow the same member to be added twice

This patch add an existence check before add new member for image.

Fixes bug 1231485

Change-Id: I10d37c6f169e070ea6699cca78b6360be9fb11dc

[{'created': '2013-09-17 04:02:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix misused assertTrue in unit tests

Refactored unit tests to use assertEqual instead of assertTrue
where needed.

Fixes bug #1226374

Change-Id: Iac5117c7a8dd3769aa6e303c6830aad291d5a0f7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix misused assertTrue in unit tests

Refactored unit tests to use assertEqual instead of assertTrue
where needed.

Fixes bug #1226374

Change-Id: Iac5117c7a8dd3769aa6e303c6830aad291d5a0f7

commit_message:
Rework run_shell_command

A previous patch for windows support made the simple case of passing a
string to run_shell_command complicated with quoting. Clean that up by
reverting to list, which avoids the crazy quoting we had to do.

Change-Id: Ia3b8ac6a57e7400d0aab0d5265c851e536fb4e87

commit_message:
Don't install EPEL rpm on CentOS 6.4

Attempting to install the already-installed EPEL rpm on CentOS 6.4
causes stack-create to fail.

Change-Id: I0474622e3976113ec3b80855f3a04a3e339ab193

commit_message:
Add a test for command registration.

This would be better as a direct unit test, but I can't see where
thats done; and setuptools doesn't seem super friendly to that.

There are more commands that can be tested, but this seemed like a
good place to start.

Change-Id: I433880d9b08d07de0194450bbc90a423554e347c

subject: Add the ability to validate default options value
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 14:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/55/38155/1/check/gate-oslo.config-pep8/227 : SUCCESS in 1m 31s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/55/38155/1/check/gate-oslo.config-docs/227/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 41s
- http://logs.openstack.org/55/38155/1/check/gate-oslo.config-python26/228 : SUCCESS in 1m 40s
- http://logs.openstack.org/55/38155/1/check/gate-oslo.config-python27/227 : SUCCESS in 1m 13s
'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-22 21:16:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Yeah, you're right - we need to address this. Thanks for the patch

There is a backwards compat concern, though - there's a good chance this will cause some grizzly service that does IntOpt(default='foobar') fail to start up if oslo.config is updated

So, I think this needs to be opt-in - e.g. a validate_defaults=False kwarg to ConfigOpts.__call__()

Also, I'm not so keen on converting the defaults values ... I think we want validation here, not conversion. For example, BoolOpt(default='false') behaviour being unexpected. I think we should require the default be specified using the correct type."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-07-22 23:48:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Agree with mark.Maybe there's not enough test code if this feature should be needed."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-23 05:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My "I think we need validation" comment might not have been clear - I think we do need some code in oslo.config that checks that default values are the correct type'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-23 12:38:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-23 12:39:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-08-06 17:10:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

A few comments inline.

Since the validation for all of the types is basically the same, I wonder if it would be cleaner to just implement _validate_value like this:

if not isinstance(value, self._expected_type):
    raise ValueError('Value is not a %s' % self._expected_type().__class__.__name__)

And have each class set the _expected_type attribute instead of having their own copies of _validate_value."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-08-13 21:40:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

[{'created': '2013-07-22 14:15:43.000000000', 'message': 'Validate default options value

Currently, the default options value provided are note generated, which can
triggers fun things like a IntOpt having a "foobar" as default value, with
code failing later when the option is being used.

This patch introduces a _convert_default_value function that can be used to
coerce the default value to the expected type.

Change-Id: I6c1998a3be3f1579139317cd85d56b42cabf89db
'}, {'created': '2013-07-23 12:38:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add the ability to validate default options value

Currently, the default options value provided are note validated, which
can triggers fun things like a IntOpt having a "foobar" as default
value, with code failing later when the option is being used.

This patch introduces a _validate_value method that can be used to
validate the default value to the expected type.

ConfigOpts.__call__ gains a validate_default_values arguments that can
trigger default value validation. The argument is False by default in
order to not break existing code.

Ultimately, we could in a later version validate the default at Opt
object creation time, which would be much better, but that may break
existing code, so we'll see.

commit_message:
Add the ability to validate default options value

Currently, the default options value provided are not validated, which
can trigger fun things like a IntOpt having a "foobar" as default value,
with code failing later when the option is being used.

This patch introduces a _validate_value method that can be used to
validate the default value to the expected type.

ConfigOpts.__call__ gains a validate_default_values arguments that can
trigger default value validation. The argument is False by default in
order to not break existing code.

Ultimately, we could in a later version validate the default at Opt
object creation time, which would be much better, but that may break
existing code, so we'll see.

Change-Id: I6c1998a3be3f1579139317cd85d56b42cabf89db

[{'created': '2013-09-05 08:04:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix H202 assertRaises Exception

Align the hacking version between test-requirement and global requirement.

The change of H202 detection from 0.6 to 0.7 in hacking is:

-    if logical_line.startswith("self.assertRaises(Exception)"):
+    if logical_line.startswith("self.assertRaises(Exception,"):

then more cases are detected by this change. Fix the exposed H202 error.

There is a special test case:
tests/v3/test_endpoints.py:test_update_invalid_interface

ref = self.new_ref(interface=uuid.uuid4().hex)

this line can not generate proper parameter for self.manager.update,
add a parameter "endpoint" for it, according to the
definition in keystoneclient/v3/endpoints.py:EndpointManager.update.

Otherwise, there will be following error after changing the Exception
to exceptions.ValidationError:
TypeError: update() takes at least 2 arguments (6 given)

Fixes Bug #1220008

commit_message:
Fix H202 assertRaises Exception

Align the hacking version between test-requirement and global requirement.

The change of H202 detection from 0.6 to 0.7 in hacking is:

-    if logical_line.startswith("self.assertRaises(Exception)"):
+    if logical_line.startswith("self.assertRaises(Exception,"):

then more cases are detected by this change. Fix the exposed H202 error.

There is a special test case:
tests/v3/test_endpoints.py:test_update_invalid_interface

ref = self.new_ref(interface=uuid.uuid4().hex)

this line can not generate proper parameter for self.manager.update,
add a parameter "endpoint" for it, according to the
definition in keystoneclient/v3/endpoints.py:EndpointManager.update.

Otherwise, there will be following error after changing the Exception
to exceptions.ValidationError:
TypeError: update() takes at least 2 arguments (6 given)

Fixes Bug #1220008

Change-Id: I8f7ed7a6eebf8576a6db5fecd86b9d19a15c8d60

subject: Retain disk-image-builder log files
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-08 11:11:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-tripleo-incubator-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/95/50295/1/check/gate-tripleo-incubator-docs/4f14941/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 26s
'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2013-10-08 11:41:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I really like the idea here.  

However, when the command is piped to tee, you lose all the buffered output on the terminal from yum.  This is actually really important to me because often I get pointed at a very slow yum mirror, or I'm using a mirror that is configured for aggressive throttling.  The throttling often results in download speeds of less then 10KB/s after the first few packages are downloaded.  Believe it or not, it is actually often quicker to ctrl-c at that point and start over.

Even if I don't ctrl-c it, just knowing what the delay is in the image build process is valuable, and I don't think you'd be able to tell that after this patch.

You can use the unbuffer command from the expect package to get around this aspect of pipes, but then the output in the tee file is not as pretty.  But, that's arguably Ok, as it's just a log file.

Another way around it might be to use the script command somehow."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-10-08 17:43:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for looking James

Using unbuffer would be pretty ugly

You could say that folks who don't want buffered out could choose to just not copy and paste that bit, but ... meh

Really, diskimage-builder should have a --logfile argument, but I'm not sure we'd be able to avoid the buffering with that approach either

Leaving this here for now to see if anyone has better ideas"}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-10-08 22:58:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So this is going to stall I think. Can we either:
a) file a bug and abandon the patch or
b) merge the patch and file a bug on yum about mirror selection/performance information when piped ?'}, {'account_id': 6488, 'date': '2013-10-08 23:20:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure if theseare "better", but I think they warrant some consideration:

* Fix yum to have a way to use more verbose output when !tty is stdout. This is generally useful for anybody who wants to monitor a long automation process that includes something that may take a long time.

* With Ubuntu we use squid proxies to get around the slow mirror problem. Yum does this wonky thing with mirror selection that results in _extremely_ poor hit rates. So perhaps the right answer is to recommend having a local squid, and then provide a way to force a single mirror to improve hit rates.

* Also we intend to build a local mirror for apt-get, we can do the same for yum.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-10-09 05:15:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2013-10-09 11:06:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Given the lack of good options here, I'd be fine with resurrecting this patch and applying.  I do see a lot of value in the log files from the image builds.

I've captured my concerns around the output in a bug here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/diskimage-builder/+bug/1237345"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-10-09 12:33:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 07:47:28.000000000', 'message': 'Support Huawei driver upgrade from grizzly to havana

To make the driver upgrade from grizzly to higher versions, the patch
checks the old host name firstly when creating and deleting host in
Huawei storage system.
If the old host name exists:
*get and use it directly when adding host.
*delete it directly when deleting host.

Closes-bug 1237189

Change-Id: I82a9dbc1ef0bb0b91771afea4aadec5afe65eecf
'}]
commit_message:
Support Huawei driver upgrade from grizzly to havana

To make the driver upgrade from grizzly to higher versions, the patch
checks the old host name firstly when creating and deleting host in
Huawei storage system.
If the old host name exists:
*get and use it directly when adding host.
*delete it directly when deleting host.

Closes-bug 1237189

Change-Id: I82a9dbc1ef0bb0b91771afea4aadec5afe65eecf

commit_message:
Don't use default value in LimitingReader

We can't simply pass the None default on to the read operation as this
default is handled differently between different wsgi implementations.

Change-Id: I337e797b8dee3dfcf9299fe361cf197a176c8fe2
Fixes: bug 1213106

I'm not 100% behind merging this at this stage of the release cycle. This seems like it has a high risk of regression"}, {'account_id': 4987, 'date': '2012-08-25 00:34:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Brian - actually this is a very important change for making OpenStack HA. It's basically the only thing that prevents it from being useful in an HA setup (with HA mysql and rabbitmq) because connections in the pool get poisoned at db server restarts or failovers and not much can be done about this from an operations perspective (except maybe restart all openstack services upon a mysql restart/failover). Surviving a database restart seems like a pretty fundamental capability for a system like openstack...

Brian, is there anything that could bring you some confidence in this change - some extra-rigorous testing (we at Mirantis are going to have quite a few opportunities to test it with customer deployments in the near future), or more explanations, or something?

Devananda, maybe this change can be simplified so that at least we can survive database restarts and nothing else? However it looks like it's already pretty minimal..."}, {'account_id': 4987, 'date': '2012-09-01 00:24:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Brian, have I convinced you? :)'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-09-03 18:03:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I understand what it's doing, but I'm mainly concerned about the chance of introducing new bugs by making these changes. If there is a way you could prove it works in the form of repeatable unit tests, that would be great."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-09-11 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Some HACKING.rst compliance issues in your test_db_retry.py.  Also, some suggestions on other things that probably need testing'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2012-09-12 19:22:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (4 inline comments)

(3 inline comments)

Looks good to me.  I'm not ready to +2 prior to feature freeze, however, unless you can answer this in the affirmative: have you run nova with this patch against a mysql database and tested behavior when connections are allowed to expire and when the mysql database is brought down, then later brought back up?  Kudos if you've run a full-up smoketest suite like Zodiac against it as well :)"}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2012-09-12 20:33:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: (3 inline comments)

> have you run nova with this patch against a mysql database
> and tested behavior when connections are allowed to expire

Yes. In devstack, one needs to adjust report_interval to be greater than sql_idle_timeout in order for any connections to timeout. That being done, with this patch I observed no errors from the timeouts.

> and when the mysql database is brought down, then later
> brought back up?

Yes, many times. Specifically, I watched devstack's screens while stopping mysqld (both gracefully and ungracefully) in the middle of large operations (eg, booting a nova instance) and then restarting it after some time. The console shows the log output from the while: True loop inside wrap_db_error(), and resumed successfully in all my tests. Now... in theory, a hard-kill of mysqld at _just_ the right moment (ie, in the middle of some transaction) might still be able to break things, but it's a heck of a lot better than how things are now :)

> Kudos if you've run a full-up smoketest suite like Zodiac against it as well :)

Nope... perhaps I can get Jay to give me a hand with this?"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-09-12 20:45:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(3 inline comments)

Excellent!  Just making sure it's thoroughly tested :)"}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2012-09-13 16:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-09-13 17:28:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

@Eugene, sorry that I somehow missed one of your comments a few weeks ago, regarding bug 1040694 in glance. Yes, this should fix that bug. I'm going to port the code over and submit it today."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-09-13 21:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Work In Progress

Needs to wait for grizzly. Potential backport to folsom later'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-09-21 02:35:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Do not merge

I really dislike this patch. Not because of the implementation, but because of how it can lead to corruption of data and very difficult to troubleshoot bugs.

Since nova uses transactions in a variety of places, automatically reconnecting is going to cause rare, but unexpected behavior.

I think it's a mistake to enable anything like this patch for nova while it still uses transactions (which is likely to be a long time).

This problem isn't specific to MySQL, but their documentation on the subject goes over what happens when a connection is dropped mid transaction:

http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/auto-reconnect.html

There isn't an easy solution for this, especially in the API side of things. On the other services, an orchestration-type of service could help solve this problem by letting the request fail and then retrying from the start again."}, {'account_id': 4987, 'date': '2012-09-21 20:02:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Johannes, you certainly have a point - the patch is not perfect, and a perfect solution is perhaps just to fail fast and fail hard at connection errors (though without sacrificing integrity), and do retries at the highest possible level - done by clients.

However, I believe that this patch is still a lot more useful than its absence, and I believe in *a lot* of cases it would save the day. Specifically:

1) We don't care about readonly queries at all - this patch works fine for them
2) Most updates in Nova are non-transactional - this patch, with a very high probability, works fine for them too. A corner case is when network disappears immediately after database commits the changes - then the change could be repeated.
3) Most even transactional updates are very short, and in general the database update load isn't too high except for extreme deployments. And the parts where the load could be high, are often tolerant to repeated updates.

So, I think the benefits from this patch outweigh its shortcomings after all.

Discuss?"}, {'account_id': 4987, 'date': '2012-09-21 20:04:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

To rephrase: I believe that the effort to do things *perfectly*, as you suggest, is so high (I believe it requires more than just database retries, as database changes aren't the only changes being done by nova transactions) that if we don't even use *this* patch, we'll have nothing at all for a long time."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-09-21 20:18:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

I don't even think there is a problem needing fixing here.

The code already does reconnects, but in a safe manner (albeit not as comprehensively as this patch would, but that's a feature). There is a small performance hit as a result, but I've never seen any metrics that indicate this is a problem.

In our public cloud at Rackspace, we haven't had a problem where this patch would help.

Also, I will always choose correctness over performance. Always. Although there is a only a small chance this patch will cause problems by reconnecting in the middle of a transaction, it will happen to someone.

The integrity of the data in the database is important and I don't think we should be so cavalier with it."}, {'account_id': 4987, 'date': '2012-09-21 21:55:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

The use cases where this patch is useful are as follows:
* Currently services cannot start up if the database is down. Well - this is fixable by retrying connect().
* If the database is restarted (or undergoes a failover), all connections in the pool are poisoned and I have to restart the services.

How about this, then: disable retries when inside a transaction?

Actually, I'm looking at the trunk code right now and I see that *in theory* these things probably shouldn't be happening, so I'll reproduce them again and see why the current patch prevents them from happening but the trunk code doesn't."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-06 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-06 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2012-10-11 23:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

@All,
I have a session around Nova DB issues on Thursday at 3:20. It would be great to hear from folks who think this patch is a /bad/ idea to understand why and what can be done about it.

Thanks,
Deva'}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2012-10-12 00:04:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

As far as "what problem does this patch solve" -- when the MySQL connection is interrupted during a long-running nova operation (such as starting an instance), the entire operation is aborted (errored out). This patch would allow the operation to resume once the database connection is available again.

I agree with Eugene's points, that this patch is not perfect, but feel that it's better than what we currently have. 

A secondary thing this patch does is to safely remove all the "SELECT 1" spam, which are just a waste time anyway, but can't safely be removed without a patch like this one.'}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-10-09 15:28:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: (1 inline comment)

'}]

commit_message:
Catch database-has-gone-away errors and retry

Wrap certain session and query methods, and catch exceptions caused by a
failed or broken database connection. When caught, retry the last query
in a loop until it succeeds, or until we time out. The time out is
configurable with min, max, and increment options. The current defaults
will result in 20 retries spread over 155 seconds.

As a result of better disconnect error handling, we can remove the
ping_listener() which generated spurious "SELECT 1" queries.

However, we can not yet disable pool_reset_on_return; doing so would
cause dangling transactions and lead to random failures between threads
viewing old versions of the data.

Fixes bug 1007027.

Change-Id: If4b20ab75ef712314327a6c8e167a28d89657091

commit_message:
Apply six for metaclass

__metaclass__ cannot be used in python3.
six be used in general for python 3 compatibility.

Change-Id: I9fc7a59df3af29b4cc1287c40fa4e883d994a961
Closes-Bug: #1236648

commit_message:
Fix redhat error message in case if user does not have licenses.
UI make link clickable on the fly, so if link has dot symbol
at the end of link dot symbol will be part of link.

Change-Id: I95fbf7c156c93c877ba4d59cf0c5edf2d6662135

commit_message:
Fixes for node selection

Don't allow to check disabled node checboxes
Don't allow to edit roles for offline nodes
PRD-1698 fix
PRD-1937 fix

Change-Id: I8225e02457dce8115a4ce8de0dd39315b8f2dfc2

commit_message:
Add the new neutron horizon settings to the local settings template

There were multiple new options included in local_settings.py
in horizon for havana. This patch is to update the template
to inlucde the missing ones.

Change-Id: Id507fb257e9dbb3d5f41f64906b7d84f984aa33e

commit_message:
Replace deprecated method aliases in tests

Some of the TestCase methods have been deprecated since python 2.7.
We need use correct names.

http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#deprecated-aliases

* replace 'assertEquals' with 'assertEqual'

Change-Id: I6c3a569ebaeac0d85b0a6fe2c24f183d8d157663

This seems harmless. However, it's not clear why this is necessary. What issue arises if the file is not cleared first?"}, {'account_id': 8641, 'date': '2013-10-09 04:03:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Matthew, this is just like we use a variable without initializing it.

If we simply append to /tmp/*-env.sh, run it. 

What if it's previous content is wrong, or what if we have some compatible issues as savanna keep growing?"}, {'account_id': 7555, 'date': '2013-10-09 13:27:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I'll give you it could be good defensive practice. And I'm generally ok +1'ing on that alone.

As I understand it this file is just created on cluster start and should not be touched after. Since a cluster only starts once the file is never going to grow.

If you agree that's the case, just fix up the commit message so a future archaeologist doesn't bang their head against a wall wondering why did this "Need to be emptied" if there was no specific problem with the current code.

Something like: Defensively empty the *-env.sh files in case they are ever appended to multiple times'}, {'account_id': 8641, 'date': '2013-10-09 13:40:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8641, 'date': '2013-10-09 13:41:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Need to empty /tmp/*-env.sh, before appending

Defensively empty the *-env.sh files in case they are ever
appended to multiple times.

append_oozie_setup function simply append to /tmp/oozie-env.sh.

We'd better initial oozie-env.sh with empty content first.

The same apply for generate_setup_script function.

Change-Id: If9c02e85856272d0b48ef7d79e2f329c58aa148b
Close-bug: #1235481

commit_message:
Removing deprecated using of flags module from project

Moving file flags.py to manila/common/config.py,
replacing FLAGS by CONF. Rename modules fake_flags to conf_fixture,
test_flags to test_conf, declare_flags to declare_conf,
runtime_flags to runtime_conf like it was done in cinder, nova, glance etc.

Implement bp: use-oslo-conf

Change-Id: I38d869123e5e706d3b06f1844b97ead05e22668f
