(9 inline comments)

-1 because I have questions (but I love the benefits of this patch!).

*Biggest question*: what's our configuration file path strategy across the project?

Do we want: 

* ~/.marconi/proxy.conf, ~/.marconi/queues.conf
* ~/.marconi-queues/marconi.conf, ~/.marconi-proxy/marconi.conf
* ~/.marconi/marconi-proxy.conf, ~/.marconi/marconi-queues.conf
* Something else?

I ask because I believe these locations are influenced by the two parameters to config loading (prog, that other one).

Next question: is the syntax CFG.foo.bar equivalent to CFG['foo:bar']? If yes, which do we prefer?

Thanks for this!"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-10-03 22:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (4 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6943, 'date': '2013-10-04 14:08:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

@zyuan Not sure I understand the "reversed patch" comment.

commit_message:
Use oslo.config directly instead of common.config

We've been using a wrapper around oslo.config that worked well at the
early stages of the project. Now, as the project grows, we need to user
more features from oslo.config that wouldn't make sense to export
through the wrapper we have.

This patch deprecates marconi.common.config and uses oslo.config
directly where needed.

This is the first patch around the bp remove-global-config, upcoming
patches will completely remove the usage of a global instance.

Partially-implements remove-global-config

Change-Id: Ie14c6bae8cdb72a6ed93a12c34cd8b156e059872

commit_message:
Store test scenario results in DB

*) Add new table TaskResult to store results of each test scenario

*) Add 2 new methods to DB:
task_get_detailed - returns task with results
task_result_create - create result record for task

*) Add to CLI new method that shows detailed infromation about task.

*) Add new method to Task class to append results

*) Store results into DB

implement bp db-task-track

Change-Id: I52dc6c76d44230b0685773a77601700e3d0b4f91

commit_message:
Fix FK violation errors in InstanceActionTestCase

A few tests of InstanceActionTestCase inserts rows,
that have no corresponding values in 'instances' table,
and this causes FK violation errors.

This change fixes InstanceActionTestCase when running
tests on PostgreSQL/MySQL or on SQLite with FKs enabled.

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: I9ec39d5f4c21ba5a627b289164480c694bc1539c

commit_message:
Fix test_shadow_tables() on PostgreSQL/MySQL

Migration 209 creates a few new tables for storing of temporary
data (they all have names starting with 'dump_'). This breaks
test_shadow_tables() of ArchiveTestCase, which checks that every
existing table has a corresponding shadow table.

The DB API tests currently succeed only because they are run on
SQLite, and migration 209 is no-op for SQLite DB backend.

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: I632454fdacf35be972668f394496466978b5616f

This endpoint should not be available for auto completion after typing
savanna...

'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2013-10-08 22:33:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't understand how this fix is linked to tbe bug: in the bug, you mention that you use a group "that are defined outside of the template". But here you're changing the SecurityGroup resource, so obviously it's not defined outside of the template. Can you redefine the bug to really describe the problem you're having? Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 6624, 'date': '2013-10-09 06:20:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I have a template snippet that creates a security group, and a launch configuration referencing that security group.  The launch configuration also references a pre-existing security group.  This works, in that instances are put in both security groups on launch.  The problem is that when you delete the stack, heat tries to delete the pre-existing security group as well as the one declared in the template, and gets an 'in use' client exception back from nova.

Does that make it clearer?

Template snippet for reference:

        "mySG": {
            "Type": "AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup",
            "Properties": {
                "GroupDescription" : "Security Group for test webservers",
                "SecurityGroupIngress" : [{
                        "IpProtocol": "tcp",
                        "CidrIp": "10.253.144.113/32",
                        "FromPort": "80",
                        "ToPort": "80"
                    }
                ]
            }
        },
        "myLCOne": {
            "Type": "AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration",
            "Properties": {
                "ImageId": "CentOS64-1309-1",
                "InstanceType": "m1.small",
                "SecurityGroups": [ { "Ref": "mySG" }, "9f85b91f-4478-4e3d-9465-af86fce634b6" ],
             }
         }
        "myASGrpOne": {
            "Type": "AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup",
            "Version": "2009-05-15",
            "Properties": {
                "AvailabilityZones": {
                    "Fn::GetAZs": ""
                },
                "LaunchConfigurationName": {
                    "Ref": "myLCOne"
                },
                "MinSize": "3",
                "MaxSize": "3"
            }
        }'}, {'account_id': 7193, 'date': '2013-10-09 07:05:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi all, I looked at the comment history and think I understand Stephen's problem. What I am asking myself is the following: isn't this a generic problem that you want to reference existing openstack resources in a Heat template, so shouldn't there be a generic solution to the problem instead of one point solution for security groups?

For example, I might want to refer to existing neutron networks to just deploy instances into the network. And during stack deletion, I don't want the network to be deleted.

I have to admit, I did not look at all the code that might handle the generic case; there are still places in Heat I don't know well ..."}, {'account_id': 6624, 'date': '2013-10-09 07:38:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Referencing existing networks already works fine, so that's why I approached it this way - I was assuming a bug in the implementation of the security group resource, rather than a more general problem."}, {'account_id': 7193, 'date': '2013-10-09 08:00:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the clarification. The real question I have is: is referencing an existing resource something each resource implementation has to handle (this is what it looks like), or shouldn't Heat handle this in a common way.

Aynway, I realize that this is outside the scope of this patch, so I don't want to hijack the discussion. If the implementation is like it is (each resource has to handle it), then the patch is certainly ok."}, {'account_id': 6624, 'date': '2013-10-09 12:39:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I can no longer reproduce the problem I had.  I'm going to close this for now, and revisit it if I can get a stack trace again."}, {'account_id': 6624, 'date': '2013-10-09 12:42:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Can no longer reproduce the problem'}]

[{'created': '2013-10-07 11:19:35.000000000', 'message': "It's OK to fail to delete an in-use security group

Specifying 'shared' security groups in a cloudformation template is a
common practice.  When the stack is deleted, it shouldn't fail because
that security group is still in use.

Change-Id: I744797a4104b810fda563b3295b36b21235bb11d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Gran <stephen.gran@guardian.co.uk>
Closes-Bug: #1236305
"}, {'created': '2013-10-07 20:43:20.000000000', 'message': "It's OK to fail to delete an in-use security group

Specifying 'shared' security groups in a cloudformation template is a
common practice.  When the stack is deleted, it shouldn't fail because
that security group is still in use.

Change-Id: I744797a4104b810fda563b3295b36b21235bb11d
Closes-Bug: #1236305
Signed-off-by: Stephen Gran <stephen.gran@guardian.co.uk>
"}]
commit_message:
It's OK to fail to delete an in-use security group

Specifying 'shared' security groups in a cloudformation template is a
common practice.  When the stack is deleted, it shouldn't fail because
that security group is still in use.

Change-Id: I744797a4104b810fda563b3295b36b21235bb11d
Closes-Bug: #1236305
Signed-off-by: Stephen Gran <stephen.gran@guardian.co.uk>

commit_message:
Fix import keypair help text

The existing text was just copied from the create keypair view.

This commit adds a bunch more help text and instructions for creating
an SSH keypair from a terminal.

Change-Id: I43cb31ac0fcf46dbd1c607687810caf0e18ffde4
Closes-bug: #1237264.

commit_message:
Fixed default value for ssh public key

This value was hardcoded to '/root/.ssh/id_rsa
Make it valid for any user '~/.ssh/id_rsa'

Change-Id: I3a6bfedad9066653a3b98d4bdc3c60b213b896fb

commit_message:
Correct use of ConfigFilesNotFoundError

ConfigFilesNotFoundError.__init__() takes "config_files", not
"path". And pass the config value itself rather than the result
of find_file(), which is always None.

Change-Id: Ia5285d252d5636892c4fbeb9191a6c7ed4923b78
Closes-Bug: 1236176

commit_message:
Adding 'download_image' policy enforcement to image cache middleware

Currently image cache middleware not care 'download_image' policy, the
enforcement caused user receive empty content but with HTTP 200 code
rather than 403 when client attempt to download image using v2 API. And
the real Forbidden exception be logged in glance-api log which image
application action raised. The end user is confused by this behavior.

Fixes bug: 1235378

Change-Id: Ibaa7ccf8613ee3cce4cb6a72e3206a2c94122222
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Libvirt: default device bus for floppy block devs

Even though 'floppy' is a valid device type, libvirt driver was
not supporting it.

This patch makes the bus for floppy devices be defaulted to 'fdc' if not
specified, when running libvirt with KVM.

Also it makes the device name prefix for devices on the fdc bus default
to 'fd' so that it is possible to default device names for floppy
devices. It also makes the fdc count as valid bus for kvm/qemu
hypervisors.

This effectively adds support for the floppy devices in the libvirt
driver.

Closes-bug: #1229273

Change-Id: If030109fa16a2518a550fc0dc31341442262756c

commit_message:
Utilize assertIsInstance

Using assertTrue and the 'isinstance' function to test
if an object is in an instance of some class is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIsInstance which was created
for these types of tests. Let's use assertIsInstance for these tests.

Change-Id: Ife6ee0d96bcfa448f746378a52d0102fd44a7a28

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 10:22:38.000000000', 'message': 'Don't try validate TemplateResource properties in template_validate

If the user runs "heat template-validate ..." and one of the resources
is a TemplateResource we won't be able to validate the properties
of that resource as we have to instantiate the TemplateResource
to kick off downloading the template and conversion of parameters to
properties.
Note: validation will happen properly when the user creates the stack
      so this just delays the validation of one resource type by one step.

Change-Id: I6ce53a9e78ae470b54320862fe910eef9f603941
Closes-bug: #1236327
'}]
commit_message:
Don't try validate TemplateResource properties in template_validate

If the user runs "heat template-validate ..." and one of the resources
is a TemplateResource we won't be able to validate the properties
of that resource as we have to instantiate the TemplateResource
to kick off downloading the template and conversion of parameters to
properties.
Note: validation will happen properly when the user creates the stack
      so this just delays the validation of one resource type by one step.

Change-Id: I6ce53a9e78ae470b54320862fe910eef9f603941
Closes-bug: #1236327

This prevents a user's template resources from getting overridden
by a resource plugin.

Change-Id: Idd1a5155dd28d662df8cdc44d190e24c84fd7a81
Closes-bug: #1236107

commit_message:
Move the registration of the global env to after plugin resources

This prevents a user's template resources from getting overridden
by a resource plugin.

Change-Id: Idd1a5155dd28d662df8cdc44d190e24c84fd7a81
Closes-bug: #1236107

commit_message:
Make the testing of resource loading easier

Pass an environment object around so tests don't have
to use the global object and then conflict with other tests.

Change-Id: I0d9a0d3bd825ac415847213ee4a5d7473f80dbd6
Partial-bug: #1236107

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 10:43:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a issue on retrieving default quota in Create Project

quota names for security group are different between nova and neutron,
so the same appoach can be used for floating IP. This commit reverts
the change in get_default_quota_data in commit c44552fe66 and changes
get_disabled_quotas to determine security group and rules quotas come
from nova or neutron.

Change-Id: I9e39ac99f1e8c7ccdce64b2e2ab79615cac50892
Closes-Bug: #1235053
(cherry picked from commit 9fa87dad193f0324762b684ab08ecb8dfc6ce1cc)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a issue on retrieving default quota in Create Project

quota names for security group are different between nova and neutron,
so the same appoach can be used for floating IP. This commit reverts
the change in get_default_quota_data in commit c44552fe66 and changes
get_disabled_quotas to determine security group and rules quotas come
from nova or neutron.

Change-Id: I9e39ac99f1e8c7ccdce64b2e2ab79615cac50892
Closes-Bug: #1235053
(cherry picked from commit 9fa87dad193f0324762b684ab08ecb8dfc6ce1cc)

commit_message:
Fixing Rally config json schema

The patch extends the json schema used to validate the input Rally config.
New keys have been added according to recent changes in the test engine
(see benchmark.rally.utils.ScenarioRunner.run() method).

Blueprint test-engine
Closes-Bug: #1237285
Change-Id: I98d5add2b7b11c5c46abe9eca57bc70eeb11e955

swift is one of the openstack services it should not be in the
global-requirements.txt as no other service like nova included.

* Removing swfit from global-requirements.txt
* Removing swfit from tests/files/gr-base.txt

Change-Id: I20f00e9f481378be880af67adb340f32a6fa53c7
'}]
commit_message:
No obvious reason for having swfit in the requirements

swift is one of the openstack services it should not be in the
global-requirements.txt as no other service like nova included.

* Removing swfit from global-requirements.txt
* Removing swfit from tests/files/gr-base.txt

Change-Id: I20f00e9f481378be880af67adb340f32a6fa53c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 16:46:22.000000000', 'message': "Don't display non-tenant Floating IP in Floating IP project tab

Previously Floating IPs from all tenants are displayed when logged
in as a user with admin role and Neutron is enabled. Neutron API
returns resources from all tenants when the API is called with admin
role, so we need to call the API with additional filter parameter to
limit the results to a given tenant.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py
(cherry picked from commit 3827a7e73ab1daf317e3fbf903a57c31f95bf293)

Closes-Bug: #1226224
Change-Id: I47ddf77cd3c5d4c6141a67cb32c22cc917b485e6
"}]
commit_message:
Don't display non-tenant Floating IP in Floating IP project tab

Previously Floating IPs from all tenants are displayed when logged
in as a user with admin role and Neutron is enabled. Neutron API
returns resources from all tenants when the API is called with admin
role, so we need to call the API with additional filter parameter to
limit the results to a given tenant.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py
(cherry picked from commit 3827a7e73ab1daf317e3fbf903a57c31f95bf293)

Closes-Bug: #1226224
Change-Id: I47ddf77cd3c5d4c6141a67cb32c22cc917b485e6

[{'created': '2013-10-08 14:37:24.000000000', 'message': 'Make ProviderFactory.get_provider more simple

Provder name can be found in provider config, so first argument of get_provider
is not necessary. Now provider can be created by calling
ProviderFactory.get_provider(provider_config) instead of

'}]
commit_message:
Make ProviderFactory.get_provider more simple

Provder name can be found in provider config, so first argument of get_provider
is not necessary. Now provider can be created by calling
ProviderFactory.get_provider(provider_config) instead of
ProviderFactory.get_provider(provider_name, provider_config)

Change-Id: Idc579ef6c362b4180fa4f24201363bc0b8d3ac33

Function discovery_check from wsgi_utils.py has been modified: all logic
that provides creation of set of deployment_tags was moved to function
_get_cluster_depl_tags (_request_to_nailgun replacement) which also handle

support new logic.

Change-Id: Iee8459e77dd5a56cf69aecdc03e61ddff58c784a
'}]
commit_message:
Test fixes

Some non-major fixes to unit tests of wsgi controllers and functional
tests.

Savanna/Murano deployment tags add

Function discovery_check from wsgi_utils.py has been modified: all logic
that provides creation of set of deployment_tags was moved to function
_get_cluster_depl_tags (_request_to_nailgun replacement) which also handle
all requesting process to nailgun. nailgun_mimic.py was modified to
support providing of new fixture data for testing purposes. Tests for
function _get_cluster_depl_tags were added in new file
test_support_utilities.py.

Unified deployment tags.

For nose discovery plugin unified treating (casting to lower case) of deployment tags for
testsets and tests were added. Unit tests were modified in order to
support new logic.

Change-Id: Iee8459e77dd5a56cf69aecdc03e61ddff58c784a

commit_message:
Added rack topology configuration for hadoop cluster

Configuration includes topology for compute nodes and swift nodes.

Co-Authored-By: Alexander Kuznetsov <akuznetsov@mirantis.com>

Implements: blueprint rack-and-vms-location-should-pass-to-cluster

Change-Id: I0fdd6ef084507c3a1054bbd50e030f22534231b2

[{'created': '2013-10-08 19:31:13.000000000', 'message': 'Handle DB2 disconnect

If the DB2 server was restarted, database connections would fail,
requiring a restart of the Keystone server.

This change adds an on-checkout handler for DB2 similar to the
MySQL handler.

Change-Id: Ie53d9606edac408401961fc6526bb7c99baa836a
Closes-Bug: #1231657
(cherry picked from commit f18dbd7e74303b7e0af97439ed935038e2231feb)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle DB2 disconnect

If the DB2 server was restarted, database connections would fail,
requiring a restart of the Keystone server.

This change adds an on-checkout handler for DB2 similar to the
MySQL handler.

Change-Id: Ie53d9606edac408401961fc6526bb7c99baa836a
Closes-Bug: #1231657
(cherry picked from commit f18dbd7e74303b7e0af97439ed935038e2231feb)

commit_message:
Disable H803 check.

H803: Git commit title should not end with period.

I don't think we really care whether a commit title ends with a period
or not. Certainly not enough to warrant patches failing checks and
wasting people's time and CI resources.

Change-Id: I52fd73c35545943b1a7e2cec62ddb52a5f90a24b
Closes-bug: 1236621.

commit_message:
rename httpd/keystone.py to httpd/keystone.wsgi

This matches openstack-dashboard[1]
.py is misleading since this isn't usable outside mod_wsgi

[1] https://github.com/openstack/horizon/tree/master/openstack_dashboard/wsgi

Change-Id: I1ba7f0e0f72d5c9fa1d06cec2b50551eb7f2e296

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 17:39:07.000000000', 'message': 'Savanna/Murano deployment tags add

Function discovery_check from wsgi_utils.py has been modified: all logic
that provides creation of set of deployment_tags was moved to function
_get_cluster_depl_tags (_request_to_nailgun replacement) which also handle
all requesting process to nailgun. nailgun_mimic.py was modified to
support providing of new fixture data for testing purposes. Tests for
function _get_cluster_depl_tags were added in new file
test_support_utilities.py.

Change-Id: I417e9f83c8d83f5b90bb868c1240d670b76c0ea4
'}]
commit_message:
Savanna/Murano deployment tags add

Function discovery_check from wsgi_utils.py has been modified: all logic
that provides creation of set of deployment_tags was moved to function
_get_cluster_depl_tags (_request_to_nailgun replacement) which also handle
all requesting process to nailgun. nailgun_mimic.py was modified to
support providing of new fixture data for testing purposes. Tests for
function _get_cluster_depl_tags were added in new file
test_support_utilities.py.

Change-Id: I417e9f83c8d83f5b90bb868c1240d670b76c0ea4

commit_message:
Add V2 and V3 api for PCI passthrough

All pci passthrough code is merged into nova,but the API
does not support. this patch extend the servers/os-hypervisor
to show PCI infomation for instance and compute node, and also
provides a resource:endpoint to show PCI infomation.

bp:pci-passthrough-libvirt
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Pci_passthrough#PCI_passthrough_use_notes

Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Shuangtai Tian <shuangtai.tian@intel.com>
Change-Id: I7b0ae489226edf39eb0d3120a85a7cee0e669d11

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 09:30:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing glance-api hangs in the qpid notifier

Glance-api was able to hang in qpid notifier under heavy image creation load.

The ``thread`` and ``select`` modules used by the python-qpid for managing
the AMQP connection. When the eventlet was not able to switch between threads
because leaded to hang and/or pipe(2) leaking issues.

* Monkey patching the ``select`` and ``thread`` modules to be  eventlet friendly
  in order to avoid hanging issues.

* The reference to the connection object in the QpidStrategy
  was replaceable by a concurrent thread, which could cause various issues.
  Using just local variables for storing connection object in order to avoid
  concurrent unsafe manipulation.

Fixing bug 1229042

Change-Id: I8fa8c4f36892b96d406216cb3c64854a94ca9df7
(cherry picked from commit 2e7aa761b6c2b31f4cbd9703ee19090b6757508a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing glance-api hangs in the qpid notifier

Glance-api was able to hang in qpid notifier under heavy image creation load.

The ``thread`` and ``select`` modules used by the python-qpid for managing
the AMQP connection. When the eventlet was not able to switch between threads
because leaded to hang and/or pipe(2) leaking issues.

* Monkey patching the ``select`` and ``thread`` modules to be  eventlet friendly
  in order to avoid hanging issues.

* The reference to the connection object in the QpidStrategy
  was replaceable by a concurrent thread, which could cause various issues.
  Using just local variables for storing connection object in order to avoid
  concurrent unsafe manipulation.

Fixing bug 1229042

Change-Id: I8fa8c4f36892b96d406216cb3c64854a94ca9df7
(cherry picked from commit 2e7aa761b6c2b31f4cbd9703ee19090b6757508a)

commit_message:
Inventory RPC service and filtering based on host properties

Add an RPC service.
The hosts can be filtered by taking into account their properties.
The returned hosts have running_vms = 0.
The filter is the json_filter extracted from the Nova scheduler.

Change-Id: I05201741c5f3345fca2481fc257da7d21504488a

subject: Fix huawei HVS driver cannot set transfer strategy for smart tier function
messages: [{'account_id': 6604, 'date': '2013-10-09 09:00:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 08:50:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix huawei HVS driver cannot set transfer strategy for smart tier function

Huawei HVS driver supports QOS and Tier functions. User can
open those functions by setting volume type. QOS requires users
to set flow strategy and io priority. Tier requires user to set
distribution policy and transfer strategy.

The current driver limits the QOS strategy to be "Qos-high",
"Qos-normal" and "Qos-low" which is not direct, and just allows
user to set distribution policy: "Tier-high", "Tier-normal" and
"Tier-low".

This patch changes the keys of QOS and Tier and adds transfer
strategy for Tier. Also it checks QOS strategy status when adding
new lun to the strategy.

Change-Id: Ie6338063c384097258578067f722b693eb56fbfb
Closes-bug: #1237268
'}]
commit_message:
Fix huawei HVS driver cannot set transfer strategy for smart tier function

Huawei HVS driver supports QOS and Tier functions. User can
open those functions by setting volume type. QOS requires users
to set flow strategy and io priority. Tier requires user to set
distribution policy and transfer strategy.

The current driver limits the QOS strategy to be "Qos-high",
"Qos-normal" and "Qos-low" which is not direct, and just allows
user to set distribution policy: "Tier-high", "Tier-normal" and
"Tier-low".

This patch changes the keys of QOS and Tier and adds transfer
strategy for Tier. Also it checks QOS strategy status when adding
new lun to the strategy.

Change-Id: Ie6338063c384097258578067f722b693eb56fbfb
Closes-bug: #1237268

commit_message:
VMware: Disallow snapshot of attached volume

The current implementation perform snapshot of attached volume.
This is invalid because when we take snapshot of the backing, the instance
continues pointing to the readonly delta and tries writing to it.
This patch will disallow snapshot creation of attached volume.

We have similar issue with delete of snapshot, when deleted the instance will
point to an invalid disk file, since that will get merged with its parent.
Hence any writes by the instance will fail with disk not found error.
This patch will ignore delete snapshot of attached volume.

Since we disallow snapshot of attached volume, we disallow linked clone of
attached source volume and also upload of attached volume.

Fixes bug: 1236891

Change-Id: I6a91eac8529836d1fe1de73bf6b28ec098aa7c54

commit_message:
Utilizes assertNotIn

Using assertTrue and the 'not in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertNotIn
which was created for these types of tests.

Fixes bug #1230028

Change-Id: Ibaf6c73c514b9ad27f8f37eb3f1043e31dbfdcc1

commit_message:
Adds missing entry in setup.cfg for V3 API shelve plugin

Adds the missing entry in setup.cfg which allows the V3 API
shelve plugin to be loaded. Also adds a v3 version of the unittests
for the shelve plugin.

Change-Id: I737ca0cae503b726b0103a4ae169ffca91188c87
Closes-Bug: #1233454

commit_message:
Fix PCI devices DB API tests

Stub values of PCI device addresses, which are used in
DB API tests of PCI devices code, do not fit into 'address'
column of 'pci_devices' table (that is of type VARCHAR(12)),
because they actually have length of 13 characters.

The tests succeed with SQLite, but fail with both PostgreSQL
and MySQL.

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: I5757fa07618d9a0e944704c8fbff3c6bcb15d37d

commit_message:
Fix DB API tests depending on the order of rows

A few DB API tests depends on the specific order of returned rows
in SQLite (i. e. ORDER BY is not specified for DB queries). This
order can be different when running tests on PostgreSQL or MySQL,
so the tests must be fixed to not depend on it.

Blueprint: db-api-tests-on-all-backends

Change-Id: Ibc0094edf70b03264e78878ebb6a6bdcb1fb942d

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-08-08 18:36:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm this looks like a bit of a big hammer.
I'll look later to see if we can avoid the subsequent fallocate on the images (which could be owned by qemu or root depending on system setup). Note looking at a system here shows that nova is in the qemu group and the 'disk' files are owned by qemu, so a chmod g+w would be sufficient. That even though a smaller hammer is a bit hacky.

Maybe the best approach is to have fallocate() create the files, and just avoid fallocate if the files exist."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-08-08 18:36:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 2967, 'date': '2013-08-13 09:36:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

hi p-draigbrady,

I tried to use chmod, but it failed.
I found that the libvirt will change disk's owner and group. On my system(ubuntu), when the virtual machine is power on, it belongs to kvm:libvirt-qemu. However, when the virtual machine is power off, it belongs to root:root. so when the nova try to power on the virtual machine it fails.
rootwrap do looks like a bit of a big hammer, but it do resolve this problem."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-21 06:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-21 06:03:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-08-21 11:04:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm worried that we're going through this path at all again
Anyway a workaround could be to:

  # We explicitly check write access to avoid preallocation
  # after the image has been booted (and the permissions
  # possibly changed) as is the case during hard reboot.
  if (size and self.preallocate and self._can_fallocate() and
      os.access(self.path, os.W_OK)):
      utils.execute('fallocate', '-n', '-l', size, self.path)"}, {'account_id': 2967, 'date': '2013-08-22 03:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Restored'}, {'account_id': 2967, 'date': '2013-08-22 03:52:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-08-22 03:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
fallocate image only when user has write access

Libvirt will change instance's ownership when the instance became power
off which will make nova-compute service unable to hard reboot instance
bacause the nova-compute service has not write access. This commit will
allocate space for image only the first time we create image.

fixes bug 1200113

Change-Id: Id81b09ade5f870665f5ffabab3cde144c6dec210

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 05:05:25.000000000', 'message': "Add a Timeout when getting Memcache connections

The old Timeout behavior when pulling connections of the MemcacheConnPool left
ambiguity around what timed out and could put more placeholders in the queue
than the configured max_connections.

To avoid waiting indefinitely on slow severs we raise a custom Timeout when we
fail get a connection from the pool.  We still error limit the slow server,
and move onto the next, but we still don't allow more than max_connections.

Change-Id: I9e2409896423d52da69e35c038e5f457c71f705d
"}]
commit_message:
Add a Timeout when getting Memcache connections

The old Timeout behavior when pulling connections of the MemcacheConnPool left
ambiguity around what timed out and could put more placeholders in the queue
than the configured max_connections.

To avoid waiting indefinitely on slow severs we raise a custom Timeout when we
fail get a connection from the pool.  We still error limit the slow server,
and move onto the next, but we still don't allow more than max_connections.

Change-Id: I9e2409896423d52da69e35c038e5f457c71f705d

[{'created': '2013-10-09 01:59:41.000000000', 'message': 'Utilizes assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone

Using assertEqual/assertNotEqual to test if an element
is or is not None is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone
which were created for these types of tests.

Change-Id: I2e430e87dd0222b194a84f2928ad36aac26aaba6
'}]
commit_message:
Utilizes assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone

Using assertEqual/assertNotEqual to test if an element
is or is not None is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertIsNone and assertIsNotNone
which were created for these types of tests.

commit_message:
Provide user with more information on quota fail

Provide the user with useful information when a snapshot or volume
create fails because it would cause the user to exceed available quota.
Specifically report the user's current gigabyte usage and quota
allocations.

Closes-Bug: #1235148

Change-Id: Ib4c5dbcbd172c69834c2824791af755380f38e01

commit_message:
Handle FILE_EXCEPTIONS properly

The test for exceptions was testing the full path instead of just the file.

Also, fix invocation of validate_all_files.

Change-Id: Iecc48b40cbd19769b983017083b1427a057c1e0c

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 6463, 'date': '2013-10-08 06:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Restored'}, {'account_id': 6463, 'date': '2013-10-08 09:29:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-10-08 09:53:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't believe this is correct.

In libvirt < 0.10.0 we created a single cgroup

  $ROOT/libvirt/qemu/$GUESTNAME

and set the 'quota * nvcpus' value at that level

In libvirt >= 0.10.0 we create one cgroup per vCPU

  $ROOT/libvirt/qemu/$GUESTNAME/{vcpu0,vcpu1,....}

and set the 'quota' value at the vcpuN level.

The end result is the same in both cases - you get 'quota * nvcpus' worth of time allowed."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-10-08 10:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
fix cputune.quota setting bug

Setting of cputune.quota has changed in libvirt from version 0.10.0. So the
cputune.quota parameter which is writed into the libvirt xml shouldbe set
differently under different version of libvirt.

Change-Id: Ie2f408e1a1a17fb8ae1ab809f556f0028a9f336c
Fixes: bug#1230050

[{'created': '2013-09-04 03:22:13.000000000', 'message': "Utilizes assertIn and assertNotIn - 2/3

Using assertTrue and the 'in' operator to test if an element is in a sequence
is too python2.4. Our unit testing framework supports assertIn and
assertNotIn, included from python 2.7, which were created for these types of
tests. Let's use assertIn or assertNotIn for these tests.

There are about 90+ files which needs change. Still 30+ to go.

commit_message:
Utilizes assertNotIn - 2/2

Using assertTrue and the 'not in' operator to test
if an element is in a sequence is too python2.4.
Our unit testing framework supports assertNotIn,
which was created for these types of tests.

Change-Id: I8a6935afe8766acf0ca53e7f2c1cdacd1b0218bb

Change-Id: I7b3ffd11a5b60447d54449a7253c2f6bd2951c6e
'}, {'created': '2013-10-09 02:15:44.000000000', 'message': "NetApp documentation for Havana

Change updates the NetApp Unified driver documentation for Havana.

As the window to update the code's option text is closed for release,
this patch manually updates the automatically generated table
cinder-netapp.xml to allow for presenting the best possible text to
users on release. The code should be updated at a later date.

Change-Id: I7b3ffd11a5b60447d54449a7253c2f6bd2951c6e
"}, {'created': '2013-10-09 02:23:35.000000000', 'message': "NetApp documentation for Havana

Change updates the NetApp Unified driver documentation for Havana.

As the window to update the code's option text is closed for release,
this patch manually updates the automatically generated table
cinder-netapp.xml to allow for presenting the best possible text to
users on release. The code should be updated at a later date.

Change-Id: I7b3ffd11a5b60447d54449a7253c2f6bd2951c6e
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp documentation for Havana

Change updates the NetApp Unified driver documentation for Havana.

As the window to update the code's option text is closed for release,
this patch manually updates the automatically generated table
cinder-netapp.xml to allow for presenting the best possible text to
users on release. The code should be updated at a later date.

Change-Id: I7b3ffd11a5b60447d54449a7253c2f6bd2951c6e

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-09-26 14:46:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

:(  They removed it?  Sam!!!'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-09-29 11:09:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

so 2 things.

First... that commit message is terrible. :)

8035a76 Use 0.6.3, 0.6.1 is not available anymore.

Please fix the message to be descriptive.

Also, if docker is randomly removing stuff from upstream package repos like this, I actually think we should remove it from devstack. This was my objection to external repos in the first place."}, {'account_id': 7838, 'date': '2013-09-30 21:07:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Installing docker 0.6.1 works just fine: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/0ef4b76c3773a226efd7

What error did you encounter? I did not test through devstack though... It's fine to use 0.6.3 though, no API change."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-10-01 11:34:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@sam, the package is gone'}, {'account_id': 7838, 'date': '2013-10-01 15:43:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

tl;dr, The following patch will fix the issue: https://gist.github.com/anonymous/b4afb0b942727fda31be

Ok I found the issue. When a new version of docker is packaged, a package named "lxc-docker-VERSION" is created. The meta-package "lxc-docker" is then updated to the latest version.

It's not possible to install older version through the meta-package. The install_docker.sh script uses the meta-package.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-10-09 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-10-09 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Remove path from image-api

glanceclient appends the protocol version to the endpoint URL, so the
path needs to be empty

Change-Id: Ib7ab474fefa1f6aaafa30c5390e448cda7a65c40

commit_message:
Add versioning/migration capability

Add a simple migration layer that can be used
to upgrade flow or task details to newer versions
which will be useful for pre-engine activation to
ensure that the data that is associated with a task
or flow is compatible.

Change-Id: Ie107384cc72dbfca481d2b8c39af0c59fdf22ea9

commit_message:
Raise ConfigFilesNotFoundError if CONF.api_paste_config not found

Otherwise it shows an incomprehensible message
"'NoneType' object has no attribute 'startswith'."

Change-Id: I5d87c4ceac69b26730d63727a2ec3701ccc9cecb
Closes-bug: 1236182

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-26 15:45:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix default value for a header

This code specified None as the default value, but it would raise an
exception if that was ever returned.  An empty string causes the code to
work as intended.

This came up while I was writing a unit test for another bug fix.

Change-Id: I658bb8a9b5124f281988fb60b645182ea0ccf99f
Related-bug: #1231524
'}]
commit_message:
Fix default value for a header

This code specified None as the default value, but it would raise an
exception if that was ever returned.  An empty string causes the code to
work as intended.

This came up while I was writing a unit test for another bug fix.

Change-Id: I658bb8a9b5124f281988fb60b645182ea0ccf99f
Related-bug: #1231524

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-29 07:55:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix test_changelog when git isn't globally setup.

This test was assuming that it was possible to make a new git repo and
commit to it, but some versions of git will error if no user email is
set, and some users choose not to have that set globally.

Change-Id: I94401c4fe716021c2cb2f1585690463746c740c9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test_changelog when git isn't globally setup.

This test was assuming that it was possible to make a new git repo and
commit to it, but some versions of git will error if no user email is
set, and some users choose not to have that set globally.

Change-Id: I94401c4fe716021c2cb2f1585690463746c740c9

subject: Add package info, make guide openSUSE version independent

commit_message:
Add package info, make guide openSUSE version independent

Add information about OpenStack packages for Ubuntu and
openSUSE.

Update openSUSE information, remove FIXMEs for openSUSE where nothing
needs to be done.

Remove some Ubuntu specific instructions that do not apply from
section_dashboard-system-reqs.xml.

Don't mention openSUSE version in titles etc (like Fedora guide does).

Change-Id: I68dea39441afc6bf5271672ccf35429893591965

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-03 11:50:46.000000000', 'message': 'Allow tests to run with both provenances of mox

We currently have a requirement for mox >= 0.5.3.

Confusingly there are two flavours of "mox 0.5.3"
in the wild:

1) pypi's mox-0.5.3.tar.gz (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mox)
2) Google's mox-0.5.3.tar.gz (https://code.google.com/p/pymox/)

These are not exactly the same; tests can pass on (1) may
fail on (2).

Fedora packages are based on (1) while Debian/Ubuntu packages
are based on (2).

This is a know issue: https://code.google.com/p/pymox/issues/detail?id=40

When running the tests using a virtual env (1) is used, but
on Debian/Ubuntu when not running using a virtual env (2)
will be used: this leads to 3 of the 1740 tests failing.

This patch allows all 1743 tests to run whether you are running
in a virtual env or using Debian/Ubuntu/Fedora packages.

Fix for bug 1212625.

Change-Id: Ib0b11ec18aafbfb7f3d243bf149b94f93a1c13c9
'}, {'created': '2013-10-03 11:52:24.000000000', 'message': 'Allow tests to run with both provenances of mox

commit_message:
Allow tests to run with both provenances of mox

We currently have a requirement for mox >= 0.5.3.

Confusingly there are two flavours of "mox 0.5.3"
in the wild:

1) pypi's mox-0.5.3.tar.gz (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mox)
2) Google's mox-0.5.3.tar.gz (https://code.google.com/p/pymox/)

These are not exactly the same; tests which can pass on (1) may
fail on (2).

Fedora packages are based on (1) while Debian/Ubuntu packages
are based on (2).

This is a known issue: https://code.google.com/p/pymox/issues/detail?id=40

When running the tests using a virtual env (1) is used, but
on Debian/Ubuntu when not running using a virtual env (2)
will be used: this leads to 3 of the 1740 tests failing.

This patch allows all 1743 tests to run whether you are running
in a virtual env or using Debian/Ubuntu/Fedora packages.

Fix for bug 1212625.

Change-Id: Ib0b11ec18aafbfb7f3d243bf149b94f93a1c13c9

Fix misused assertTrue in unit tests

Refactored unit tests to use assertEqual instead of assertTrue
where needed.

Closes-Bug: #1226374

commit_message:
Record the L3 sevice plugin of ML2 into Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES

All the service plugins are defining their own pluin in
Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES and then neutron script will write it as
the value of service_plugins configuration item.

Bug #1227200

Change-Id: I606c4bb8249944e6705ae520bb5cb59ac4f77719

[{'created': '2013-10-08 20:43:25.000000000', 'message': 'Change instances of OS-FILTER to OS-EP-FILTER

Mark Miller reported this on -dev mailing. There are some instances of
OS-FILTER being used in the endpoint filtering documentation.
This patch will change those instances to OS-EP-FILTER.

Change-Id: I5bd1986ee36a3fadc25d289cea4819c70c3c3e0e
'}]
commit_message:
Change instances of OS-FILTER to OS-EP-FILTER

Mark Miller reported this on -dev mailing. There are some instances of
OS-FILTER being used in the endpoint filtering documentation.
This patch will change those instances to OS-EP-FILTER.

Change-Id: I5bd1986ee36a3fadc25d289cea4819c70c3c3e0e

subject: Test for the nova diagnostics API
